Dialogue.Stage Direction: Mist swirls across the rocky ground. Suddenly, a head in tin helmet and gas mask pops up from behind a ridge. Then a second, and a third, and more. Like World War One troops going over the top of the trenches, they advance - and promptly get mown down by machine gun fire. The Doctor appears, trying to keep warm, and looks around him. There is no one to be seen.

Dialogue.Line: Ah. Welcome, Doctor.
What's going on? Don't you realise how dangerous it is to intercept a transmat beam?
Oh come, Doctor, not with our techniques. We Time Lords transcended such simple mechanical devices when the universe was less than half its present size.
Look, whatever I've done for you in the past, I've more than made up for. I will not tolerate this continual interference in my life.
Continual? We pride ourselves we seldom interfere in the affairs of others.
Except mine.
You, Doctor, are a special case. You enjoy the freedom we allow you. In return, occasionally, not continually, we ask you to do something for us.
I won't do it. Whatever it is, I refuse.
Daleks.
Daleks? Tell me more.
We foresee a time when they will have destroyed all other lifeforms and become the dominant creature in the universe.
That's possible. Tell on.
We'd like you to return to Skaro at a point in time before the Daleks evolved.
Do you mean avert their creation?
Or affect their genetic development so that they evolve into less aggressive creatures.
Hmm. That's feasible.
Alternatively, if you learn enough about their very beginnings, you might discover some inherent weakness.
All right, just one more time.
You'll do it?
Yes. If you'll let me have the space time coordinates, I'll set the Tardis for Skaro.
There's no need for that, Doctor.
Huh?
You're here. This is Skaro.
What?
We thought it would save time if we assumed your agreement.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Time Lord holds up a gold bangle with a three-ended swirl on it.

Dialogue.Line: What's this?
A Time Ring. It will return you to the Tardis when you've finished here. There's just one thing.
What's that?
Be careful not to lose it. That Time Ring is your lifeline. Good luck, Doctor.
Just a moment.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: But he has already vanished.

Dialogue.Line: Don't just disappear! What about Sarah and Harry?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor puts the Time Ring on his left wrist and moves on. Sarah and Harry appear over a small ridge.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor! Doctor!
Ah, there you are, Sarah.
I say, Doctor, that was a pretty rough landing. What happened?
Yes, where are we? This isn't the beacon.
No, there's been a slight change of plan.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Boom!

Dialogue.Line: This is Skaro.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Wheeeeee!

Dialogue.Line: I say, that's gunfire.
Heavy artillery.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Boom!

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, it's getting closer!
It's a creeping barrage. Get down!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They leap into a nearby bomb crater as explosions happen all around them.

Dialogue.Line: Something's annoyed them.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The barrage stops.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor. Doctor, look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It's a soldier in a gas mask.

Dialogue.Line: All right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor picks up his rifle as Harry checks him over.

Dialogue.Line: Nothing can be done for this chap.
That's strange. There's centuries between these two weapons.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He picks up a ray gun.

Dialogue.Line: What's that on his jacket?
Radiation detector and a gas mask. The two things don't go together, do they.
Part of his uniform is made of animal skins, and yet the combat jacket is a modern synthetic fibre.
It's like finding the remains of a stone age man with a transistor radio.
Playing rock music?
A thousand year war? Civilisation on the point of collapse.
What?
Nothing. Just theorising, that's all.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He puts the weapons down.

Dialogue.Line: Come along.
Where are we going?
Er, forward.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They move on through the desolate terrain, past corpses and through a pile of large rocks.

Dialogue.Line: Halt! Don't move.
What is it?
I see a land mine. We're in the middle of a mine field. Follow me and tread in my footsteps.
Good King Wenceslas.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor looks up at the cliffs.

Dialogue.Line: What?
I thought I saw something move. I have a feeling we're being watched.
I get that feeling, too.
I can't see anything.
Let's hope it's imagination.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor suddenly stops.

Dialogue.Line: What is it?
Harry, I'm standing on a land mine. I felt it shift.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sure enough, something round and metal is amongst the chips of rock under his left foot.

Dialogue.Line: If I move my foot, it might detonate it.
Don't move your foot.
I won't.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Harry kneels carefully and touches the mine.

Dialogue.Line: It's rocking.
Wedge something under it. Make it firm.
Yes, I'm trying to, Sarah. Back up, Sarah.
You back up too, Harry. No point in risking both our lives.
No, Doctor, you'll have a better chance if I hold it firm.
Please, Harry, don't be difficult.
Don't you argue, Doctor. Now, just lift your foot very, very gently.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor does so, and nothing goes bang.

Dialogue.Line: Thank you, Harry.
My pleasure.
Let's go.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Up on the cliff, something watches them move on. They arrive at a load of barbed wire.

Dialogue.Line: Hey, look. What do you think?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A squat dome is a little way away.

Dialogue.Line: It's like a big bubble.
Protective dome.
What, large enough to cover an entire city?
Yes.
Why are they fighting with old-fashioned things like barbed wire and land mines if they can build something like that?

metadata.title: Arrival on Skaro
metadata.description: The scene opens on Skaro, a war-torn planet, where mist swirls across a desolate landscape littered with the remnants of past battles. Soldiers in tin helmets and gas masks stagger into view, echoing the horrors of World War One, only to be cut down by machine gun fire. The Doctor materializes, looking bewildered as he surveys the battlefield. He is soon confronted by a Time Lord who explains the dire situation regarding the Daleks, imploring him to assist in averting their impending rise to power. The Doctor reluctantly agrees, realizing the gravity of the situation as explosions shake the ground around him.

events.title: The Doctor Arrives
events.description: The Doctor appears amidst the chaos of a battleground, confused and attempting to comprehend the situation. He notices the ongoing warfare and the presence of soldiers. Suddenly, a Time Lord materializes, greeting the Doctor and drawing attention to the danger posed by the Daleks, who could potentially become the dominant life forms in the universe.
key_dialogue: Ah. Welcome, Doctor.
What's going on? Don't you realise how dangerous it is to intercept a transmat beam?
Daleks.

events.title: The Time Lord's Request
events.description: The Time Lord explains to the Doctor that they have transcended the technology of a transmat beam and need his help to return to a critical moment on Skaro before the Daleks evolve. They discuss the various options available to the Doctor, including preventing their creation or altering their genetic makeup.
key_dialogue: We'd like you to return to Skaro at a point in time just before the Daleks evolved.
Do you mean avert their creation?
Hmm. That's feasible.

events.title: Doctor's Agreement
events.description: After some discussion, the Doctor expresses his willingness to help and agrees to return to Skaro. The Time Lord presents him with a Time Ring, which will allow him to return to the TARDIS once his mission is complete. The Doctor is still confused but determined, as the Time Lord vanishes, leaving him to ponder his next move.
key_dialogue: I'll suppose I'll have to help you—just one more time.
A Time Ring. It will return you to the TARDIS when you've finished here.

events.title: The Doctor's Companions Arrive
events.description: As the Doctor adjusts to his surroundings and the implications of his mission, his companions Sarah Jane Smith and Harry Sullivan appear over a ridge, calling for him. The Doctor expresses relief upon seeing them, but confusion arises as they realize they are not where they intended to be.
key_dialogue: Ah, there you are, Sarah.
What happened?
This isn't the beacon.

events.title: The Barrage Begins
events.description: Suddenly, the ground shakes under the sound of heavy artillery, prompting the Doctor to take cover with Sarah and Harry. They dive into a bomb crater as explosions start to rain down nearby, making it clear that they are caught in a dangerous conflict.
key_dialogue: It's getting closer!
Get down!

events.title: Discovery of the Soldier
events.description: Once the barrage has subsided, the Doctor leads Sarah and Harry out of the crater to investigate. There, they discover a soldier in a gas mask who has succumbed to the violence around them. The Doctor examines the body, remarking on the strange juxtaposition of ancient and modern weaponry.
key_dialogue: It's like finding the remains of a stone-age man with a transistor radio.
What's that on his jacket?

events.title: The Minefield
events.description: As the trio traverses the desolate battlefield, the Doctor realizes they have stumbled into a minefield. He instructs Sarah and Harry to follow his footsteps carefully. Tension builds as they navigate through the dangerous area, aware of the potential for disaster at any step.
key_dialogue: Harry, I'm standing on a land mine.
You back up too, Harry. No point in risking both our lives.

events.title: The Protective Dome
events.description: Upon successfully crossing the minefield, the Doctor and his companions come across a dome in the distance that appears to serve as a protective barrier for an unseen city. They wonder about the capabilities of the civilization that could construct such a structure, contrasting it with the outdated weaponry they have encountered.
key_dialogue: It's like a big bubble.
Why are they fighting with old-fashioned things like barbed wire and land mines if they can build something like that?

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor appears amidst the chaos of a battleground, attempting to grasp the confusion and danger surrounding him. He stands somewhat isolated, wearing his characteristic attire, with an air of determination and curiosity as he surveys the battlefield and the advancing soldiers.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor feels a mix of confusion and concern, driven by the urgency of the situation. Outwardly calm, he displays signs of distress beneath the surface, knowing the implications of the Daleks' presence and the threat they pose to the universe.
active_plans: Assess the battlefield to understand the current situation.
Engage with the Time Lord to gather information about the Daleks.
Determine a course of action to avert the impending threat.
beliefs: The Doctor believes in the sanctity of all life forms and the responsibility to protect them.
He holds a strong conviction against interfering with time and events, advocating for minimal intervention.
The Doctor understands the potential darkness within the Daleks and the necessity to counteract their existence.
goals: Short-term: Gather information and understand the conflicting forces at play.
Medium-term: Prevent the Daleks from rising to dominance.
Ultimate: Ensure the safety of all life forms across the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: The Time Lord materializes out of the mist, standing with an air of authority. Dressed in flowing robes, he surveys the Doctor with an inquisitive yet superior expression, highlighting the mastery of his time-bending abilities.
agent_participations.emotional_state: He expresses a calm confidence, but beneath it lies an underlying arrogance. His objective is clear, and he is focused on delivering a crucial message to the Doctor regarding the impending threat of the Daleks.
active_plans: Facilitate the Doctor's understanding of the situation.
Encourage the Doctor to accept the mission regarding the Daleks.
Reassert the authority of the Time Lords over their former companion.
beliefs: The Time Lord firmly believes in the superiority of the Time Lords and their right to intervene when necessary.
He is convinced that knowledge of the future gives him a unique perspective on the present situation.
He holds a belief that the ends justify the means when it comes to intergalactic matters.
goals: Short-term: Persuade the Doctor to undertake a mission against the Daleks.
Medium-term: Ensure the Daleks do not become the dominant species.
Ultimate: Maintain the supremacy and oversight of the Time Lords over the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: The Time Lord stands calmly amidst the desolate battlefield, having materialized to intercept the Doctor's transmat. He moves with an air of serene detachment, strolling as if through a garden rather than a war zone. His posture and measured pace underscore his supreme confidence and control over the situation, even in this ravaged landscape.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Time Lord projects an aura of effortless superiority and amusement at the Doctor's predictable indignation. Beneath this facade of detached amusement, he holds a serious and resolute intent to manipulate the Doctor into accepting a perilous mission. His languid tone and condescending remarks mask a deep-seated concern about the Dalek threat and a calculated strategy to utilize the Doctor's unique abilities.
active_plans: To recruit the Doctor for a mission to Skaro.
To assert Time Lord authority and technological superiority over the Doctor.
To downplay the Doctor's objections and emphasize the critical nature of the Dalek threat to ensure his cooperation.
beliefs: Time Lords possess superior intellect and capabilities compared to other beings.
Occasional intervention, even manipulation, is justified to maintain the balance of the universe.
The Doctor, despite his rebellious nature, is ultimately a reliable agent for missions requiring his specific skills and moral compass, however much he may protest.
goals: Short-term Goal: Secure the Doctor's immediate agreement to undertake the mission on Skaro.
Medium-term Goal: Ensure the Doctor successfully alters the Daleks' development or discovers a weakness.
Ultimate Goal: Prevent the Daleks from rising to universal dominance, thereby safeguarding the existing order of the universe as perceived by the Time Lords.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor materializes abruptly on the war-torn surface of Skaro, initially disoriented and expecting to be elsewhere. He pivots slowly, hands in pockets, his long scarf swirling around him as he takes in the grim surroundings with a puzzled frown. His stance and attire suggest a weary traveler, unprepared for yet another forced detour.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Initially bewildered and confused by his unexpected arrival, the Doctor quickly transitions to indignation and resentment at the Time Lord's interference. He outwardly expresses anger and frustration, challenging the Time Lord’s authority and asserting his hard-won freedom. However, beneath his protests, a flicker of grim curiosity and reluctant sense of duty is ignited by the mention of the Daleks, hinting at his inherent inclination to confront universal threats despite his weariness.
active_plans: To ascertain the reasons behind his forced relocation to this desolate battlefield.
To vehemently protest the Time Lord's interference in his personal freedom and travel plans.
To explore the situation further upon hearing about the Daleks, despite his initial reluctance, driven by his inherent sense of responsibility.
beliefs: He has earned his freedom from the Time Lords and their demands after past services.
Continual interference in his life is an unacceptable violation of his autonomy.
The Daleks are a significant threat that must be addressed, even if it means reluctantly cooperating with the Time Lords once more.
goals: Short-term Goal: Re-establish his intended journey and return to the TARDIS with his companions.
Medium-term Goal: Understand the nature and scope of the Time Lords' request concerning the Daleks.

Ultimate Goal: Navigate the Time Lords' manipulative tactics while preserving his freedom, yet ultimately address the potential Dalek threat, albeit with initial reluctance and resentment towards the imposed mission.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor stands amidst the swirling mist of Skaro, engaging in a tense conversation with the Time Lord, displaying a mix of confusion and determination as he contemplates his next move.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor exhibits a complex emotional state—an inner turmoil marked by confusion over the Time Lord's manipulative actions and resolve to confront the impending threat of the Daleks. His bright blue eyes reflect both a flicker of hope and a burdened past.
active_plans: Agree to the Time Lord's request to help with the Dalek situation.
Prepare to return to Skaro at a crucial point in time.
Plan how to navigate the dangers of Skaro and confront the Daleks.
beliefs: His freedom allows him to choose which battles to fight.
Interference in time can have devastating consequences.
Every creature, even those who seem evil, has the potential for change.
goals: Short-term: Successfully complete the mission assigned by the Time Lords.
Medium-term: Prevent the Daleks from becoming a dominant force.
Ultimate: Restore peace and balance to the universe by addressing the Dalek threat.

agent_participations.current_status: The Time Lord stands authoritatively, presenting the Doctor with a Time Ring that symbolizes both power and manipulation, a tool designed to facilitate the Doctor's compliance with their request.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Time Lord displays a composed exterior, with a hint of superiority and detachment. Beneath this facade lies a calculated intent, as they guide the Doctor's fate while ensuring their own agenda remains paramount.
active_plans: Convince the Doctor to accept the mission regarding the Daleks.
Provide the Doctor with the Time Ring, ensuring it serves as both a means of escape and a tether to their authority.
Monitor the Doctor's actions from a distance, ready to intervene if necessary.
beliefs: Time Lords possess the right to intervene in the affairs of lesser beings.
The use of advanced technology justifies any manipulation of time and events.
The Doctor's rebellion against their wishes reflects a misunderstanding of the larger cosmic order.
goals: Short-term: Secure the Doctor's agreement to their mission.
Medium-term: Maintain control over the Doctor and the unfolding timeline.
Ultimate: Ensure the Daleks do not disrupt the balance of the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor stands initially bewildered in the desolate landscape of Skaro, clad in his tweed and scarf, a picture of bemused contemplation amidst chaos. Upon hearing his companions call, his posture shifts to one of relief and acknowledgement. He then takes charge, gesturing to the landscape to emphasize their arrival on Skaro and bracing himself and his companions for the imminent dangers of this war-torn planet.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Initially puzzled and indignant at the Time Lords' interference, the Doctor's demeanor softens with relief upon seeing Sarah and Harry. A wave of apology washes over him as he explains the 'slight change of plans,' revealing a deep-seated concern for his friends’ well-being. Beneath his outward composure, a resolve hardens as he grasps the gravity of their mission on Skaro, accepting the imposed task with a sigh of reluctant duty.
active_plans: Assess the immediate dangers of their new surroundings, particularly the ongoing artillery barrage.
Explain the unexpected change of destination and the Time Lords' intervention to Sarah and Harry.
Transition from initial bewilderment to a proactive stance, preparing himself and his companions for the mission ahead on Skaro.
beliefs: He believes in his own agency, even while acknowledging the Time Lords' influence over his life.
He holds a deep sense of responsibility for his companions, especially when they are inadvertently drawn into his adventures.
He is driven by a fundamental belief in confronting challenges directly, moving 'forward' as a default response to uncertainty and danger.
goals: short_term": "Secure immediate physical safety for himself and his companions from the artillery fire.
medium_term": "Comprehend the full scope of the Time Lords' mission and its implications for him and his companions on Skaro.
ultimate": "Successfully navigate the Time Lords' imposed mission, potentially altering or preventing the Daleks' genesis, while ensuring the survival and well-being of Sarah and Harry.

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah Jane Smith crests a ridge alongside Harry, her voice calling out for the Doctor, a journalist's determination evident even in this alien landscape. She stands beside Harry, questioning their location with a practical air, her posture alert and ready to process information, prepared for the unexpected turns that define her travels with the Doctor. As artillery fire erupts, she swiftly follows the Doctor's lead, seeking refuge in a crater with practiced ease.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Though initially displaying indignation at the rough landing, Sarah’s emotional response quickly shifts to focused pragmatism, typical of her journalistic nature. Curiosity underlies her questions about their location, hinting at an eagerness to understand the situation rather than mere frustration. Her accustomedness to the Doctor's unpredictable journeys tempers any overt distress, revealing a seasoned traveler’s blend of resilience and quiet concern for the unfolding events and the Doctor's state of mind.
active_plans: Establish immediate contact with the Doctor upon arrival in the unfamiliar location.
Ascertain their current whereabouts and the reasons for deviation from their intended destination.
Seek clear explanations from the Doctor to understand the change of plans and the nature of their new environment.
beliefs: She trusts in the Doctor’s competence and experience, even amidst chaotic and unexplained situations.
She believes in the importance of direct inquiry and factual understanding to navigate uncertainty.
She holds a conviction in her own adaptability and resilience, honed through previous adventures with the Doctor, enabling her to face new challenges with a degree of stoicism.
goals: short_term": "Gain clarity on their immediate surroundings and the reasons for their unexpected arrival.
medium_term": "Comprehend the altered mission and the implications of being on Skaro instead of the space station.

ultimate": "Successfully navigate the unfolding crisis on Skaro, utilizing her observational and analytical skills while ensuring her and her companions' safety and understanding of the Doctor's plans.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry Sullivan emerges over the ridge with Sarah, immediately vocalizing his discomfort with the 'rough landing,' his naval bearing slightly disheveled but still present. He stands beside Sarah, directing his questions about their whereabouts to the Doctor with a mix of protest and genuine inquiry. As the sound of gunfire erupts, he reacts with immediate concern, his posture shifting to alert readiness as he seeks cover alongside his companions.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry's surface emotions are marked by initial protest and bewilderment at the 'rough landing,' indicative of his less seasoned experience with the Doctor’s unpredictable travels. Beneath this, a layer of concern is evident as he grapples with the sudden gunfire, his military background making him acutely aware of danger. He relies on the Doctor for guidance and explanation, betraying a mix of trust and underlying anxiety about the unknown situation and the Doctor’s often cryptic pronouncements.
active_plans: Articulate his discomfort and seek immediate reassurance about the unsettling nature of their arrival.
Demand clarification from the Doctor regarding their unexpected location and the source of the gunfire.
React instinctively to ensure his physical safety and that of his companions amidst the escalating artillery fire, following the Doctor's lead for protection.
beliefs: He trusts in the Doctor's capability to manage crises, despite his initial skepticism about the TARDIS and time travel.
He believes in direct, practical communication, evident in his straightforward questions and reactions to the unfolding events.
He is grounded in a belief in order and established procedures, likely stemming from his naval training, making him somewhat resistant to the Doctor’s chaotic and often improvisational approach.
goals: short_term": "Gain immediate understanding of why the landing was 'rough' and the nature of the perceived threat from gunfire.
medium_term": "Comprehend the deviation from their planned return to the space station and the new circumstances they find themselves in.

ultimate": "Navigate the unfamiliar and dangerous situation on Skaro, relying on the Doctor's guidance and his own practical skills to ensure survival and eventual return to safety, possibly still hoping for Earth.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor is crouched in a bomb crater, keenly aware of the incoming artillery barrage and the urgency of the situation. He takes quick glances at Sarah and Harry, ensuring they are safe while calculating their next move amidst the chaos.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor's surface emotions are a mix of alertness and determination, but deep down he feels a heavy weight of responsibility and concern for his companions. The noise of the artillery amplifies his sense of urgency, knowing they must act quickly to survive.
active_plans: To shield Sarah and Harry from the incoming fire and ensure their safety during the artillery barrage.
To assess the battlefield for a safe route amidst the explosions and chaos.
To devise a strategy for continuing their mission despite the sudden and dangerous change in their environment.
beliefs: He believes in the importance of protecting innocent lives even in dire situations.
He holds a conviction that every action must be considered carefully, especially when lives are at stake.
He trusts his instincts and experiences from past encounters with warlike civilizations.
goals: Short-term: To find shelter from the artillery fire and ensure the safety of Sarah and Harry.
Medium-term: To navigate through the battlefield with his companions and locate the source of the Dalek threat.
Ultimate: To prevent the Daleks from achieving dominance and ensure peace across the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah is crouched in a bomb crater beside the Doctor and Harry, breathing heavily from the tension. She watches the devastation unfolding around her, feeling the gravity of the situation as explosions rain down nearby.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Externally, Sarah displays a brave front, but internally she feels a surge of fear mixed with determination. She is deeply concerned for the Doctor and Harry, yet resolute in her commitment to follow them through the chaos.
active_plans: To trust and follow the Doctor as they navigate the dangerous terrain together.
To keep an eye on Harry's well-being amidst the artillery fire.
To find a way to communicate their situation to others or seek help if possible.
beliefs: She believes in the inherent goodness of the Doctor's mission and trusts his judgment.
She holds the belief that cooperation and quick thinking in crisis situations can lead to survival.
She is convinced that they must stay united and support each other to overcome threats.
goals: Short-term: To ensure her own safety and that of her companions during the artillery onslaught.
Medium-term: To find a way to escape the battlefield and continue their mission against the Daleks.
Ultimate: To play a crucial role in thwarting the Daleks' plans and restoring peace.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry is huddled in the bomb crater alongside the Doctor and Sarah, trying to keep low as the ground shakes with incoming shells. His body is tense, prepared for quick action should the need arise.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry's outward demeanor is one of focus and concern. While he tries to keep panic at bay, deep down he feels anxious about the unpredictability of the situation and the safety of his friends.
active_plans: To stay alert and protect Sarah and the Doctor from the artillery fire.
To assess their surroundings for potential escape routes as the bombardment continues.
To offer support and maintain morale among his companions amidst the chaos.
beliefs: He believes in the strength of teamwork and that they can face any danger together.
He holds a conviction that bravery is necessary in moments of crisis, prompting him to step up as a protector.
He trusts the Doctor's leadership and wisdom, often looking to him for direction.
goals: Short-term: To survive the artillery barrage without harm to himself or his companions.
Medium-term: To escape the immediate danger and regroup so they can continue their mission.
Ultimate: To contribute to the plan of thwarting the Daleks and protecting innocent lives.

agent_participations.current_status: Leading Sarah and Harry cautiously out of the crater after the artillery barrage ceases, the Doctor is immediately drawn to the fallen soldier. Kneeling beside the body, he meticulously examines the antiquated rifle and the more modern blaster pistol, his brow furrowed in thought as he contrasts the technologies.
agent_participations.emotional_state: A contemplative mood washes over the Doctor as he observes the soldier. While outwardly calm and focused on the details of the weaponry and uniform, a deep concern simmers beneath the surface. He is beginning to grasp the chaotic and illogical nature of the conflict on Skaro, sensing a civilization tearing itself apart with mismatched tools of destruction.
active_plans: To ascertain the identities and technological levels of the warring factions.
To understand the context of the 'thousand-year war' mentioned earlier.
To deduce the strategic and technological implications of the mixed weaponry found on the soldier.
beliefs: Technological disparities in warfare signify a civilization in decline or internal conflict.
Direct observation and analysis of physical evidence are crucial for understanding any situation.
Every individual casualty in war represents a tragic loss and a failure of reason.
goals: short_term": "To identify the soldier's allegiance and understand his role in the ongoing conflict.
medium_term": "To piece together the history and nature of the war on Skaro and the civilizations involved.
ultimate": "To prevent the Daleks' genesis or mitigate their future destructive potential by understanding their origins.

agent_participations.current_status: Following closely behind the Doctor, Sarah emerges from the crater, her journalist's instincts immediately kicking in. She observes the scene with a keen eye, noticing the soldier's unusual radiation detector and the strange mixture of fabrics in his uniform, pointing these details out to the Doctor and Harry with focused curiosity.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Sarah is a mixture of alert curiosity and underlying apprehension. While outwardly composed and engaged in observing the scene and the dead soldier, a subtle unease is present. The rough landing and artillery barrage have put her on edge, and the sight of the fallen soldier reinforces the grim reality of their situation, though she channels this into focused observation rather than panic.
active_plans: To gather as much information as possible about their surroundings and the conflict.
To assist the Doctor in understanding the significance of the soldier and his equipment.
To remain vigilant and identify any immediate threats or dangers.
beliefs: Careful observation of details can reveal crucial information about any situation.
The Doctor's insights are valuable and should be supported by her own observations.
Understanding the present situation is key to navigating future challenges.
goals: short_term": "To identify any immediate clues about their location and the nature of the conflict.
medium_term": "To understand the 'slight change of plans' and their new mission on Skaro.
ultimate": "To ensure her and her companions' safety and contribute meaningfully to the Doctor's mission.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry cautiously follows the Doctor and Sarah, his initial protest about the rough landing giving way to a practical assessment of the situation. He examines the fallen soldier with a doctor's eye, confirming his demise and then expressing incredulity at the soldier’s anachronistic equipment, attempting to inject humor into the grim scene with a poorly received joke.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry is experiencing a blend of professional detachment and nervous levity. While fulfilling his role as a supportive companion and medically assessing the soldier, he is clearly attempting to process the disturbing scene through humor. Beneath his slightly forced jokes, however, lies a genuine bewilderment and unease at the primitive yet technologically mixed warfare around them.
active_plans: To provide practical support and medical assessment as needed.
To understand the immediate dangers and threats in their current environment.
To maintain morale and lighten the atmosphere through humor, however inappropriate it might seem.
beliefs: Practical skills and medical knowledge are valuable in any situation.
Humor can be a useful tool for coping with stress and fear, even in grim circumstances.
Technological inconsistencies indicate something fundamentally wrong or illogical.
goals: short_term": "To ensure the immediate safety of himself and his companions.
medium_term": "To grasp the nature of the conflict and their role in the 'slight change of plans'.
ultimate": "To return to familiar and safer environments, ideally Earth, and to understand the purpose behind their unexpected journey.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor is leading the way through the battlefield, carefully navigating the treacherous minefield while instructing Sarah and Harry to follow his steps precisely. He maintains a focused demeanor, assessing the situation and the dangers around them.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor feels a deep-seated anxiety mixed with determination as he realizes the peril they are in. He exhibits a calm exterior, but underneath, he is acutely aware of the high stakes and the potential for disaster lurking at every step.
active_plans: Guide Sarah and Harry safely through the minefield.
Maintain awareness of their surroundings to avoid triggering any mines.
Formulate a plan to confront the larger dangers posed by the battlefield.
beliefs: It is his responsibility to protect his companions.
Courage in the face of danger is essential.
Knowledge and awareness can help navigate perilous situations.
goals: Short-term: Successfully guide his friends through the minefield without incident.
Medium-term: Reach safety and assess the broader situation on Skaro.
Ultimate: Defeat the Daleks and bring an end to the ongoing conflict.

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah is cautiously following the Doctor's lead, aware of the dangerous minefield they have entered. She stays close to the Doctor, focused on his instructions and trying to maintain her balance in the treacherous terrain.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Sarah experiences a mix of fear and determination. Outwardly, she displays focus and a willingness to cooperate, but internally she grapples with anxiety about the danger they face and the uncertainty of their situation.
active_plans: Follow the Doctor's guidance to safely navigate the minefield.
Support Harry and the Doctor as they progress through the battlefield.
Reflect on her own capabilities to contribute to their survival.
beliefs: Teamwork and communication are vital for survival in perilous situations.
Trusting the Doctor's instincts is essential for her safety.
Facing danger head-on will lead to positive outcomes.
goals: Short-term: Stay safe while traversing the minefield.
Medium-term: Help the Doctor and Harry find a way to confront the greater dangers on Skaro.
Ultimate: Assist in defeating the Daleks and ensuring the safety of all involved.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry is closely following the Doctor and Sarah as they navigate the minefield. He is alert and ready to react to any signs of danger, focusing on the ground and the Doctor's instructions.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry feels a sense of urgency and trepidation as they traverse the battlefield. Although he is trying to remain brave and supportive, he is internally anxious about the potential for disaster and the weight of their situation.
active_plans: Carefully follow the Doctor's directions regarding where to step.
Maintain vigilance for any signs of the dangers around them.
Support Sarah and the Doctor in their efforts to navigate safely.
beliefs: Caution is crucial in dangerous environments.
The Doctor's leadership is essential for their survival.
Working together as a team increases their chances of success.
goals: Short-term: Help navigate through the minefield without triggering any explosives.
Medium-term: Reach a place of safety where they can regroup and plan next steps.
Ultimate: Aid in the larger mission to confront the Daleks and end the war on Skaro.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor stands at the forefront, his gaze fixed upon the distant dome. He points towards it, drawing Sarah and Harry's attention to the imposing structure.  He speaks in a soft, contemplative tone, identifying it as a 'protective dome' and immediately recognizing its vast scale, remarking that it is 'large enough to cover an entire city'.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor is consumed by intellectual curiosity and a growing sense of intrigue. His bright blue eyes, usually clouded with puzzlement, now reflect a spark of fascination as he contemplates the dome's implications. Beneath the surface, a deeper unease stirs within him as he grapples with the technological paradox before them, sensing that this discovery may hold crucial answers to the mysteries of Skaro and the Daleks.
active_plans: Analyze the protective dome to ascertain its function and technological sophistication.
Share his initial assessment of the dome's scale and purpose with Sarah and Harry, guiding their observation.
Begin to formulate hypotheses about the civilization capable of such advanced construction amidst a landscape of primitive warfare.
beliefs: Advanced civilizations are often characterized by sophisticated architectural and protective structures.
Technological inconsistencies within a society can indicate internal conflicts or hidden complexities.
Careful observation and deduction are essential tools for understanding unfamiliar environments and cultures.
goals: short_term": "Identify the immediate purpose and nature of the protective dome.
medium_term": "Understand the technological capabilities of the civilization that built the dome and reconcile them with the primitive warfare observed.
ultimate": "Uncover the truth about the Daleks' origins and fulfill the Time Lords' mission by preventing their creation or finding a weakness.

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah stands beside the Doctor and Harry, her attention directed towards the distant dome as indicated by the Doctor. She visually assesses the structure, her slim frame still bearing the marks of their rough landing and the grim battlefield. She articulates her observation of the dome's appearance, describing it simply as 'like a big bubble'.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Sarah is keenly observant and inquisitive, her journalist instincts piqued by the sight of the dome.  Beneath her outward curiosity, there's a subtle undercurrent of apprehension as she tries to reconcile the dome's advanced nature with the brutal war zone they've traversed.  She looks to the Doctor for guidance, her expression a mixture of wonder and a quiet concern about what this new discovery means for their mission.
active_plans: Visually examine the protective dome, noting its size, shape, and any discernible features.
Articulate her initial impression of the dome, using descriptive language to share her understanding with the Doctor and Harry.
Await the Doctor's explanation and analysis to gain deeper insights into the dome's significance.
beliefs: Visual observation is a crucial first step in understanding unfamiliar objects and environments.
The Doctor possesses unique knowledge and expertise in deciphering complex situations.
Understanding the context of new discoveries is vital for survival and mission success.
goals: short_term": "Gain a basic visual understanding of the protective dome.
medium_term": "Comprehend the purpose and technological level of the dome within the context of Skaro.
ultimate": "Ensure her safety alongside the Doctor and Harry, and contribute to the mission's objectives through her observational skills and journalistic insight.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry stands alongside the Doctor and Sarah, his gaze fixed on the distant dome. He gazes 'in wonder' at the structure, his posture reflecting a mix of awe and bewilderment. He articulates his observation directly to the Doctor, posing a question about the apparent contradiction: 'why are they fighting a war with barbed wire and land mines if they can build something like that?'
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry is primarily characterized by wonderment and logical confusion. He is genuinely impressed by the dome, his 'wonder' conveying a sense of awe at its scale and apparent sophistication. Simultaneously, he is baffled by the technological paradox, his question revealing a straightforward, practical mind struggling to reconcile the advanced dome with the primitive warfare they have witnessed. He seeks a logical explanation for this incongruity.
active_plans: Observe the protective dome and appreciate its scale and apparent technological advancement.
Articulate his confusion and seek clarification from the Doctor regarding the technological disparity.
Await the Doctor's explanation to resolve his bewilderment and understand the situation more clearly.
beliefs: There should be a logical consistency in technological capabilities within a civilization.
Significant technological discrepancies usually indicate underlying problems or complexities.
Direct questions to experts are the most effective way to resolve confusion in unfamiliar situations.
goals: short_term": "Resolve his immediate confusion about the technological inconsistencies on Skaro.
medium_term": "Gain a practical understanding of the situation and contribute to the group's safety and progress.
ultimate": "Ensure his own safety and the safety of his companions, and support the Doctor in fulfilling the mission to the best of his abilities.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The Time Ring serves as a pivotal tool given to the Doctor by the Time Lord, symbolizing his mission and serving as a means of escape from Skaro once his objectives are completed. It is a physical manifestation of the Time Lord's manipulative influence over the Doctor's journey.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The Time Ring is a new item, yet to be placed on the Doctor's wrist, symbolizing potential and the burden of responsibility that comes with it.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The Time Ring is securely fastened on the Doctor's wrist, becoming vital for his impending journey back to the TARDIS after completing the mission assigned by the Time Lords.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor, Harry and Sarah pass through a gap in the sandbags to discover that the soldiers defending the entrance are all corpses.

Dialogue.Line: Even the dead have a part to play. Propped up to make the trenches appear fully manned.
A different sort of uniform from that other chaps.
Yes, we may have crossed the lines.
Same mixture of ancient and modern, though.
Yes. That's why I think this war's been going on for a very long time. They probably started out with the most modern equipment but no longer have the resources. They have to make do.
War of attrition, eh, only backwards. At this rate they're going to finish off with bows and arrows.
Well, it would explain the mixture of equipment.
Psst. Here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah has found a door.

Dialogue.Line: Careful, Sarah.
It's all right. It's locked.
It's pretty solid, isn't it. Some kind of service tunnel, I suppose. It might even lead into the dome.
Let's see where the trench leads.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: As they move away, a panel in the door opens and eyes look out. There is a whizz, and something explodes nearby.

Dialogue.Line: It's a gas shell!
Gas!
Poison gas!
Respirators, quick!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They plunder the corpses for their gas masks. Then troops in the rag-tag uniforms come to fight them.

Dialogue.Line: Get back!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They are quickly over powered, then men in neater black uniforms burst out through the door and machine gun them down. The Doctor groans.

Dialogue.Line: This one's alive. Get him inside.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They pick up the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: There's another one here. Get him inside, quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Harry is taken away, and Sarah is left behind.

metadata.title: Trench Ambush
metadata.description: Deep within the desolate trenches, the Doctor, Harry, and Sarah venture further, seeking answers amidst the eerie silence. They stumble upon a grim tableau: fallen soldiers propped up as macabre sentinels, a chilling testament to the war's attrition. As they ponder the archaic and advanced weaponry scattered around, a sudden whistling heralds a poison gas attack. Scrambling for survival, they don gas masks scavenged from the fallen, only to be besieged by a wave of frenzied, ragtag soldiers. A brutal hand-to-hand fight erupts in the cramped trench, a chaotic struggle against overwhelming odds. Just as they begin to gain ground, a new, more disciplined enemy in black uniforms emerges, unleashing a deadly hail of machine-gun fire. Sarah is struck down, and the Doctor and Harry are violently subdued and dragged into a dark tunnel, leaving Sarah unconscious amidst the carnage.

events.title: Silent Sentinels
events.description: The Doctor, Harry, and Sarah pass through a gap in the sandbags and are confronted by a line of soldiers.  Upon closer inspection, they realize these are not living defenders but corpses, strategically placed to give a false sense of security. The Doctor observes the grim tactic, highlighting the desperate measures of the war. They discuss the mismatched weaponry, concluding the war is one of attrition, where resources are dwindling, forcing reliance on increasingly outdated technology.
key_dialogue: DOCTOR: Even the dead have a part to play. Propped up to make the trenches appear fully manned.
HARRY: A different sort of uniform from that other chaps.
DOCTOR: Yes, we may have crossed the lines.
SARAH: Same mixture of ancient and modern, though.
DOCTOR: Yes. That's why I think this war's been going on for a very long time. They probably started out with the most modern equipment but no longer have the resources. They have to make do.
HARRY: War of attrition, eh, only backwards. At this rate they're going to finish off with bows and arrows.
DOCTOR: Well, it would explain the mixture of equipment.

events.title: Poisonous Welcome
events.description: As Sarah points out a heavy metal door set into the trench wall, hinting at a service tunnel, a sudden, ominous whistling sound cuts through the air. A gas shell hurtles through the air and explodes nearby, spewing evil-looking green smoke. The Doctor immediately recognizes the threat: poison gas. He shouts a warning, urging his companions to find respirators quickly, their exploration abruptly turning into a desperate scramble for survival.
key_dialogue: SARAH: Psst. Here.
HARRY: Careful, Sarah.
SARAH: It's all right. It's locked.
HARRY: It's pretty solid, isn't it. Some kind of service tunnel, I suppose. It might even lead into the dome.
DOCTOR: Let's see where the trench leads.
DOCTOR: It's a gas shell!
SARAH: Gas!
DOCTOR: Poison gas!
HARRY: Respirators, quick!

events.title: Ragged Assault
events.description: Responding to the gas attack, the Doctor, Harry, and Sarah frantically scavenge gas masks from the corpses propped along the trench. Before they can react, a group of raggedly uniformed soldiers bursts into the trench, weapons firing. Caught off guard, the travellers have no chance to explain their neutrality. A fierce, chaotic hand-to-hand fight erupts within the confined space of the trench as the soldiers descend upon them.
key_dialogue: DOCTOR: Get back!

events.title: Captured!
events.description: Just as the Doctor and Harry put up a valiant defense, a grinding noise signals the opening of the heavy metal door. Neatly uniformed soldiers in black emerge, armed with machine guns. They swiftly overpower the remaining ragtag soldiers and turn their weapons on the Doctor and Harry's group. Sarah, attempting to warn her companions, is struck down by a rifle butt and collapses. The Doctor and Harry are subdued, dragged unconscious through the metal door, and into the service tunnel, prisoners of the more organized force.
key_dialogue: SOLDIER: This one's alive. Get him inside.
SOLDIER: There's another one here. Get him inside, quickly.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor navigates through the trenches, examining the positioning of corpses that have been propped up to create the illusion of a well-manned defense. He reflects on the grim reality of war and the desperation it breeds.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor exhibits a mix of melancholy and resolve, grappling with the harsh realities of warfare while maintaining an analytical perspective on the situation. His observations are tinged with sadness for the lost lives and the futility of conflict.
active_plans: Assess the situation regarding the corpses and their implications for the ongoing war.
Discuss the nature of the conflict with Harry and Sarah to promote awareness.
Continuously seek a way to navigate through the trench without drawing enemy attention.
beliefs: War leads to destruction and loss, which is unacceptable.
Understanding the past mistakes of warfare is crucial to prevent future conflicts.
There is always the potential for good to arise from evil circumstances.
goals: Short-term: Navigate successfully through the trenches while gathering information.
Medium-term: Understand the implications of the war strategy on both sides.
Ultimate: Find a way to end the war and protect innocent lives from further harm.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry follows closely behind the Doctor and Sarah, actively engaging in the discussion about the corpses and their role in the battlefield. He reacts to the unsettling sight with a mix of concern and determination.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry displays a sense of responsibility and concern for his friends and the situation at hand. His demeanor is serious, reflecting the gravity of their discovery, and he is eager to support the Doctor's efforts.
active_plans: Provide moral support to the Doctor and Sarah during their exploration.
Contribute to the discussion about the war and its implications.
Remain vigilant for any threats while navigating through the trenches.
beliefs: It is important to uphold human dignity even in war.
The right to live should not be taken away by war.
There are always lessons to be learned from the past.
goals: Short-term: Stay close to the Doctor and Sarah as they explore.
Medium-term: Help uncover information about the ongoing war.
Ultimate: Assist in finding a resolution that prevents further bloodshed.

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah actively engages in the conversation about the corpses, expressing concern and curiosity about the war's impact. She investigates the surroundings with the Doctor and Harry, finding a door that may lead to an escape route.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Sarah exhibits a blend of worry and determination as she grapples with the stark reality of death in the trenches. Her investigative spirit shines through as she seeks answers and potential solutions.
active_plans: Engage with the Doctor and Harry in dialogue about the situation.
Investigate any potential means of escape or further information.
Support her friends in understanding the ramifications of the war.
beliefs: Every life lost in war is a tragedy that must be acknowledged.
Understanding the past is crucial for creating a better future.
Compassion and courage are essential even in the darkest times.
goals: Short-term: Discover more about their surroundings and potential threats.
Medium-term: Facilitate a plan to protect their group amidst the conflict.
Ultimate: Work towards finding a way to stop the war and save lives.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor, initially examining the line of fallen soldiers and philosophizing on the nature of the war, is abruptly pulled into survival mode. He immediately identifies the whistling sound as a gas shell and urgently directs Sarah and Harry to seek respirators from the fallen soldiers, his tweed jacket now incongruous against the backdrop of imminent chemical warfare.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Beneath his usual intellectual curiosity and somber reflections on war, a sharp urgency takes hold.  He outwardly projects command and decisive action, his tone firm as he warns his companions. Internally, there is a deep seated concern for Sarah and Harry's safety, masked by the need to remain pragmatic and focused on immediate survival in this deadly environment.
active_plans: Analyze the immediate threat of the gas shell.
Direct his companions to find and equip respirators.
Prepare to defend themselves against any immediate enemy action.
beliefs: Poison gas is an immediate and lethal threat requiring swift action.
Resourcefulness and quick thinking are crucial for survival in dangerous situations.
Protecting his companions is a primary responsibility.
goals: Short-term: Ensure the immediate survival of himself and his companions from the gas attack.
Medium-term: Understand the source and nature of this attack and the wider conflict.
Ultimate: Neutralize the threat posed by the war and potentially the Daleks themselves (though this is a broader, overarching goal).

agent_participations.current_status: Harry, initially absorbing the Doctor's grim analysis of the war-torn landscape, is jolted into action by the sudden whistling of the gas shell. He swiftly reacts to the Doctor's command, his naval training kicking in as he prepares to scavenge respirators, his square jaw set with determination amid the chaos.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry's initial curiosity about the battlefield transitions sharply to alert concern and focused action. He displays outward reliability and a willingness to follow the Doctor's lead without question.  Internally, there's a surge of adrenaline and a disciplined readiness to respond to danger, trusting in the Doctor's expertise and his own practical skills to navigate this crisis.
active_plans: Understand the Doctor's assessment of the immediate danger.
Immediately follow the Doctor's instructions to find respirators.
Prepare to assist Sarah and the Doctor in surviving the gas attack.
beliefs: The Doctor's warnings are credible and must be heeded without hesitation.
Practical action and obedience to authority are essential in a crisis.
Survival depends on teamwork and mutual support in dangerous situations.
goals: Short-term: Acquire and properly equip a respirator to avoid the effects of the poison gas.
Medium-term: Ensure the safety of himself and his companions during this immediate threat.
Ultimate: Return to safety and the TARDIS, leaving this hostile planet behind (an implicit, long-term desire).

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah, moments before pointing out the intriguing metal door, is caught off guard by the sudden whistling sound.  Her journalistic curiosity instantly morphs into alarm as the Doctor identifies the threat. She is now in a hurried scramble amidst corpses, her fashionable clothes starkly contrasting with the grim necessity of scavenging for survival gear.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Sarah’s initial inquisitiveness about the trench's features is abruptly overtaken by fear and a sense of urgency.  She outwardly expresses alarm and immediately reacts to the Doctor’s commands, her voice laced with concern. Internally, there’s a palpable sense of vulnerability mixed with a journalist’s instinct to observe and process the unfolding danger, even as she prioritizes immediate self-preservation.
active_plans: Alert the Doctor and Harry to the unusual door.
Process the Doctor's warning about the gas shell and understand the threat.
Actively search for and equip a respirator from the fallen soldiers to protect herself.
beliefs: The Doctor's expertise in dangerous situations is reliable and vital.
Poison gas is a serious and immediate danger that must be avoided.
Survival depends on quick thinking and decisive action in the face of unexpected threats.
goals: Short-term: Secure a functional respirator to protect herself from the poison gas.
Medium-term: Navigate the immediate danger and ensure her continued survival in this hostile environment.
Ultimate: Escape Skaro and return to her normal life, leaving behind the horrors of this war-torn planet (an underlying personal desire).

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor frantically searches for gas masks among the corpses, demonstrating urgency while battling against the unfolding chaos of the battlefield around him.
agent_participations.emotional_state: He experiences a blend of urgency and dread, feeling the weight of responsibility for his companions' safety while grappling with the harsh realities of war.
active_plans: Find gas masks to protect against the gas attack.
Ensure the safety of Harry and Sarah during the skirmish.
Engage with the soldiers to try and explain their neutrality.
beliefs: Every life has value; he seeks to protect his companions.
War is fundamentally tragic and should be avoided whenever possible.
There is a moral obligation to confront and resist evil.
goals: Short-term: Acquire gas masks to survive the poison gas attack.
Medium-term: Survive the ensuing battle and protect his friends.
Ultimate: Resolve the larger conflict and prevent further loss of life.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry assists in the frantic search for gas masks, moving swiftly between corpses while keeping an eye on the surrounding danger.
agent_participations.emotional_state: He feels a mix of determination and anxiety, driven by a need to protect his friends and survive the chaos that surrounds them.
active_plans: Help find gas masks to ensure survival against the gas attack.
Support the Doctor and Sarah during the intense fight.
Quickly adapt to the unfolding situation and react to threats.
beliefs: Teamwork is essential for survival in critical situations.
Courage can be found in the face of overwhelming odds.
There is a duty to protect those who cannot protect themselves.
goals: Short-term: Secure gas masks to avoid exposure to poison gas.
Medium-term: Help defend against the soldiers attacking them.
Ultimate: Ensure the group's survival and find a way out of the battlefield.

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah finds gas masks among the corpses, all the while glancing nervously at the perimeter as soldiers approach.
agent_participations.emotional_state: She feels fear mingled with determination, understanding the stakes of the moment and the necessity of acting quickly to protect herself and her friends.
active_plans: Search for gas masks and protect herself and her friends from poison gas.
Assist the Doctor and Harry in their efforts to survive the chaos.
Stay alert for emerging threats while aiding in the search.
beliefs: Survival often requires quick thinking and decisive actions.
Loss of life on the battlefield is a tragedy that must be prevented.
Friendship and loyalty are paramount in desperate situations.
goals: Short-term: Find a gas mask to ensure her own safety.
Medium-term: Help her friends defend against incoming soldiers.
Ultimate: Escape the battlefield and find a way to resolve the conflict.

agent_participations.current_status: The ragtag soldiers engage the Doctor, Harry, and Sarah unexpectedly, caught up in the chaos of the battlefield.
agent_participations.emotional_state: They are driven by desperation and fear, feeling the weight of their situation and the instinct to fight for survival.
active_plans: Defend their position against perceived threats.
Overpower the newcomers who they see as intruders.
Survive the ongoing battle amidst the chaos.
beliefs: Survival is paramount in the face of danger.
They believe they are defending their territory and are willing to fight for it.
Desperation can lead to irrational actions.
goals: Short-term: Successfully overpower any intruders.
Medium-term: Hold their ground against the ongoing conflict.
Ultimate: Survive the war and find a way to end the fighting.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor fights back with Venusian Aikido, a whirlwind of arms and legs against the ragtag soldiers, striving to protect Sarah and Harry. Despite his valiant effort and skillful moves, the sheer number of attackers overwhelms him. He is eventually brought down, groaning as he is captured by the black uniform soldiers.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Frustration and defiance are etched on the Doctor's face as he's forced into hand-to-hand combat. Beneath the surface, a simmering anger at the escalating violence and the Time Lords' interference fuels his determination to resist capture, even as the odds stack against him.
active_plans: Defend Sarah Jane Smith from immediate harm.
Protect Harry Sullivan amidst the chaotic brawl.
Resist capture by the attacking soldiers, even if outnumbered.
beliefs: Life is precious and must be defended, even in the face of overwhelming odds.
Freedom is a right worth fighting for, resisting unjust imprisonment.
Violence is a last resort, but necessary when protecting innocents.
goals: Short-term: Escape the immediate physical threat of the ragtag soldiers.
Medium-term: Ensure the safety and well-being of his companions, Sarah and Harry.
Ultimate: Unravel the mystery of Skaro and its connection to the Time Lords' mission.

agent_participations.current_status: Harry boxes with Navy-trained precision, delivering rights, lefts, and uppercuts, holding his ground to defend Sarah and the Doctor. He fights fiercely, but like the Doctor, is ultimately subdued by the sheer volume of enemies. He is dragged away unconscious, a prisoner of the black uniform soldiers.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry's resolve hardens with the arrival of the black uniform soldiers; fear mixes with a fierce loyalty to his friends. Beneath his outward show of strength, a deep worry for Sarah's safety and the Doctor's well-being intensifies as their situation becomes increasingly dire.
active_plans: Protect Sarah Jane Smith from the immediate danger of the melee.
Support the Doctor in defending against the ragtag soldiers.
Resist capture and attempt to create an opening for escape.
beliefs: Loyalty to friends and comrades is paramount, especially in danger.
Physical courage and action are essential responses to threats.
It is important to stand firm and fight for what is right, even when outmatched.
goals: Short-term: Survive the hand-to-hand combat in the trench.
Medium-term: Keep Sarah and the Doctor safe from harm.
Ultimate: Return to Earth and safety with his companions.

agent_participations.current_status: Sarah, initially observing the chaotic fight, hears the grinding open of the metal door and spots the new soldiers. She leaps up to warn the Doctor and Harry, but a brutal swing from a rifle butt fells her. She collapses, unconscious and vulnerable, left behind in the trench as the men are taken.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Alarm surges through Sarah as the battle intensifies and new threats emerge. Her concern for the Doctor and Harry overrides her own fear, driving her to act quickly and warn them, even as she becomes a target herself. A flicker of defiance remains as she attempts to alert them despite the overwhelming danger.
active_plans: Observe the ongoing fight to assess the situation.
Identify potential changes in the battle dynamics.
Warn the Doctor and Harry about the new threat of soldiers emerging from the door.
beliefs: Quick thinking and observation are crucial in dangerous situations.
Loyalty demands warning and protecting companions.
It is important to act decisively, even under duress.
goals: Short-term: Alert the Doctor and Harry to the new soldiers.
Medium-term: Ensure her own survival amidst the escalating conflict.
Ultimate: Escape the battlefield and reunite with the Doctor and Harry.

agent_participations.current_status: The ragtag soldiers are initially engaged in hand-to-hand combat with the Doctor and Harry, attempting to overpower them in the trench. They are then themselves overwhelmed and gunned down by the better-equipped black uniform soldiers, their bodies falling onto the Doctor and Harry.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Aggression and desperation fuel the ragtag soldiers as they attack, driven by orders and the chaos of battle.  Fear and confusion likely arise as they are suddenly outmatched and mowed down by the superior firepower of the new arrivals, turning them from aggressors to victims in an instant.
active_plans: Engage in close-quarters combat with the Doctor and Harry.
Overpower and subdue the perceived enemy combatants.
Maintain their position in the trench.
beliefs: Orders from superiors must be obeyed without question.
Aggression and force are necessary to overcome enemies in war.
Survival depends on eliminating threats and securing territory.
goals: Short-term: Neutralize the Doctor and Harry as threats.
Medium-term: Secure the trench and repel any further attackers.
Ultimate: Contribute to the war effort and survive the ongoing conflict.

agent_participations.current_status: The black uniform soldiers emerge from the metal door, armed with machine guns, and swiftly take control of the trench. They unleash a barrage of gunfire, eliminating the ragtag soldiers and then proceed to subdue and capture the Doctor and Harry, dragging them unconscious into the service tunnel.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Disciplined efficiency and cold determination characterize the black uniform soldiers. They display no hesitation or emotion as they execute their orders with lethal precision, focused solely on completing their mission to secure the area and capture the identified targets.
active_plans: Open the metal door to gain access to the trench.
Deploy machine guns to suppress and eliminate enemy combatants.
Secure the area and capture the Doctor and Harry.
Transport the prisoners to the service tunnel for interrogation.
beliefs: Superior firepower and tactics guarantee victory in combat.
Orders from command must be executed swiftly and without question.
Prisoners of war must be secured and processed for interrogation.
goals: Short-term: Clear the trench of all enemy presence and secure the prisoners.
Medium-term: Deliver the captured individuals to Command Headquarters.
Ultimate: Contribute to the overall military objectives and maintain order within the Kaled forces.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The sandbags serve as a physical barrier in the trenches, supporting the illusion of a manned defense by propping up corpses, thus manipulating the battlefield's perception. They symbolize the desperate measures taken in war.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The sandbags were intact and set in position, forming part of the trench's fortifications.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: After the Doctor, Harry, and Sarah pass through, the sandbags remain as a part of the trench's desolate landscape, continuing to serve as a tragic reminder of the war's toll.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The weapon serves as a critical element of the soldiers' uniforms, symbolizing the blend of old and new technology. It represents the ongoing conflict and the desperation of soldiers forced to use outdated weaponry.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The weapon was in use by the soldiers, representing their ongoing struggle in the war.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: Following the Doctor's observations, the weapon becomes a symbol of the soldiers' plight and the futility of their situation, left behind among the corpses.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The service tunnel door, initially discovered by Sarah and speculated to be an entrance to the dome city's service tunnels, momentarily captures the agents' attention, becoming a point of interest and potential escape. However, its primary narrative function within this event is to serve as a deceptive calm before the storm, a focal point right before the sudden and disruptive arrival of the gas shell, shifting the scene from investigation to immediate peril.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The service tunnel door is locked and set into the trench wall, its purpose and accessibility unknown to the Doctor, Sarah, and Harry. It is a static element of the environment, merely observed and commented upon.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The service tunnel door remains locked and physically unchanged after the gas shell explosion. However, its narrative status is transformed from a point of curiosity to a potential source of unknown dangers, foreshadowing the later emergence of enemy soldiers through a similar door in the trench.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The gas shell dramatically enters the scene with a piercing whistle, immediately seizing the narrative focus and escalating the tension. It acts as a weapon of sudden assault, exploding nearby and releasing a visible cloud of ominous green smoke, transforming the environment into a hazardous zone and compelling the agents to abandon exploration in favor of desperate self-preservation and initiating a frantic search for protection from the poison gas.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The gas shell is an unseen projectile approaching from an unknown location, signaled only by its distinct whistling sound. It exists as a latent threat, unheard and unseen but rapidly approaching.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The gas shell has detonated near the trench, releasing its poisonous contents into the immediate environment. It has fulfilled its function as a weapon, contaminating the air with green smoke and creating an urgent and life-threatening situation for the agents, forcing them into immediate reactive mode.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The gas masks are scavenged from the corpses of fallen soldiers, vital for protection against the poison gas used in the attack. Their discovery is urgent, as the immediate threat of gas necessitates quick action from the Doctor, Harry, and Sarah.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The gas masks are discarded and worn by the deceased soldiers, rendered useless until scavenged by the living.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The gas masks are now in the possession of the Doctor, Harry, and Sarah, providing them with essential protection against the impending gas attack.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The rifle is used by the ragtag soldiers in the ambush against the Doctor and his companions. It represents the chaotic nature of warfare and the blend of old and new technology present in the ongoing conflict. The soldiers wield it in a desperate attempt to overpower the Doctor, Harry, and Sarah.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The rifle is a standard-issue weapon, likely used previously in various skirmishes by the soldiers, but now juxtaposed against the more advanced weaponry of other factions.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The rifle is still in the possession of the ragtag soldiers, symbolizing their fight for survival, but may also be rendered useless if they are overpowered.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The heavy steel doors grind open during the hand-to-hand combat, serving as an entrance point for the black uniform soldiers. This unexpected opening dramatically shifts the battle, introducing a new, better-equipped force that quickly overwhelms the initial combatants and captures the Doctor and Harry. The doors facilitate the transition from a chaotic melee to a swift, decisive capture.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The steel doors are initially closed and locked, acting as a barrier set into the rear wall of the trench, and unmoving during the initial fight.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The steel doors are left open after the black uniform soldiers emerge, now serving as a passage into the service tunnel as the Doctor and Harry are dragged through them, becoming an entry point to a different, more secure location within the Kaled facility.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The machine guns are wielded by the black uniform soldiers as they burst into the trench. Their rapid fire and overwhelming firepower are instrumental in ending the hand-to-hand combat abruptly. The machine guns are used to mow down the ragtag soldiers and quickly establish dominance, changing the nature of the conflict from a close-quarters struggle to a one-sided suppression.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The machine guns are held by the black uniform soldiers, ready and prepared for deployment, but not yet actively used in the immediate trench scene.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The machine guns have been effectively used to subdue and eliminate the ragtag soldiers, demonstrating their devastating power and signifying the arrival of a more organized and technologically advanced military force, leaving the trench secured and the initial attackers defeated.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: Rifles are used both by the ragtag soldiers in the initial hand-to-hand combat and by the black uniform soldiers. Crucially, a rifle butt is used by one of the black uniform soldiers to strike Sarah Jane Smith, rendering her unconscious and unable to further assist the Doctor and Harry. The rifle, therefore, acts as a weapon of incapacitation, directly contributing to Sarah's removal from the fight and the subsequent capture of her companions.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: Rifles are present in the trench, carried by both the ragtag soldiers and, presumably, the black uniform soldiers before they emerge, representing the standard infantry weapon in this conflict.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: Rifles remain present but become secondary to the more decisive machine guns. One rifle is specifically used to strike and incapacitate Sarah, demonstrating its potential for both lethal and non-lethal (in this context, incapacitating) applications within the scene, and contributing to the shift in power dynamics.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Once inside, their rescuers help remove their gasmasks. The Doctor seems to be in a bad way.

Dialogue.Line: They don't look like Thals. I wonder? There've been rumours recently that the Thals were developing robots. Anyway, stick them on the transporter.I shall alert Command Headquarters with General Ravon.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The soldier gets into the front of an electric trolley on tracks, with the Doctor and Harry sitting behind him.

Dialogue.Line: Count the ammunition and clean your weapons.

metadata.title: Kaled Capture
metadata.description: Inside a dimly lit storeroom, the atmosphere is tense as the Doctor, Harry, and their rescuers are surrounded by the remnants of their earlier battle. The walls are lined with weapons and various military supplies, casting long shadows in the flickering light. The atmosphere is thick with a sense of urgency and apprehension as the Kaled soldier assists the group, indicating their immediate movement toward the Command Headquarters. Outside, the sound of distant explosions echoes faintly, hinting at the chaos unfolding beyond the confines of the storeroom. The Doctor appears weary but focused, reflecting on the challenges ahead while the Kaled soldier expresses concern about the authenticity of their appearance as Thals. As they prepare to embark on their next mission, the weight of their circumstances hangs heavily in the air, accentuated by the tension of potential betrayal and uncertainty.

events.title: Rescue in the Storeroom
events.description: As the Kaled soldier helps remove their gas masks, they reveal the strained expressions on their faces. The Doctor, visibly affected by their recent ordeal, leans against a wall for support. The Kaled soldier expresses confusion about the Doctor and Harry, questioning their appearance as they don't resemble Thals. He remarks on recent rumors regarding Thal developments, hinting at the possibility of robots. The soldier instructs his comrades to prepare for their next movement, deciding to alert Command Headquarters about their presence, as they prepare to transport the captured Doctor and Harry into the fold of the Kaled resistance.
key_dialogue: KALED: They don't look like Thals. I wonder? There've been rumours recently that the Thals were developing robots.
KALED: Stick them on the transporter. I shall alert Command Headquarters with General Ravon.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor leans against a wall for support, visibly affected after the recent ordeal, and relies on the Kaled soldier for assistance as they recover from their gas masks.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Strained yet resilient, the Doctor exhibits a complex emotional disposition, battling fatigue and confusion while his determination to survive remains intact, revealing his implicit leadership qualities.
active_plans: Survive the current ordeal and recover from the gas exposure.
Assess the situation regarding their captors and allies.
Formulate a strategy for escape and potential resistance against the Thals.
beliefs: The importance of friendship and loyalty in dire situations.
A commitment to opposing tyranny and oppression in any form.
A belief that intelligence and compassion should prevail over brute strength.
goals: Short-term: Regain composure and assess the immediate situation.
Medium-term: Escape from the current threat posed by the Thals.
