key_dialogue: DAVROS: This seems an opportune moment to end this session. Nyder. Release the prisoners. Take them to the detention area.
DAVROS: Interrogation will continue later. And I must thank you, Doctor. What you have told me will be invaluable.
DAVROS: All this information, this foreknowledge, will be programmed into the Dalek memory banks. Take them away.

events.title: A False Camaraderie and a Priceless Burden
events.description: As Harry and Sarah are led away, Davros, in a chilling display of manipulative cordiality, invites the Doctor to remain for a 'men of science' discussion. This feigned camaraderie masks Davros's true intent: to further probe the Doctor's mind and extract any remaining secrets. He instructs Nyder to personally safeguard the magnetic tape, reiterating its 'priceless' value, a stark reminder of the devastating knowledge it contains.  Nyder's departure with the tape leaves Davros and the Doctor alone, setting the stage for a deceptive, intellectually charged exchange, while the captured knowledge begins its insidious integration into the Dalek consciousness.
key_dialogue: DAVROS: Doctor, stay a moment. Sit down. Let us talk together now, not as prisoner and captor, but as men of science. There is so much I wish to know. Nyder, take charge of the tape.
NYDER: Immediately, Davros.
DAVROS: It will be your responsibility, and remember, it is priceless. It's value beyond computation.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros sits regally in his mobile chair, positioned to oversee the interrogation with an air of chilling authority. His withered hand rests near the controls, ready to escalate the pressure on the Doctor. He watches the Doctor intently, maintaining eye contact, a silent command in his very posture, ensuring his dominance over the proceedings from his immobile throne.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros is unsettlingly calm, a mask of scientific detachment barely concealing his ruthless ambition. Beneath the surface, he is driven by a fanatical zeal to perfect the Daleks, viewing the Doctor's information as the key to ultimate power. There's a cold satisfaction in his calculated cruelty, exploiting the Doctor's compassion as a strategic advantage, revealing his utter lack of empathy.
active_plans: To meticulously extract every detail of Dalek defeats from the Doctor's memory.
To psychologically break the Doctor's resistance and force his cooperation.
To secure the invaluable information on tape for immediate integration into Dalek programming.
beliefs: Superior intellect and ruthless efficiency are the only paths to true power.
Emotional vulnerabilities are weaknesses to be exploited and eliminated.
The Daleks are the ultimate evolution, and their supremacy is his ordained destiny.
goals: {type: short-term, description: To compel the Doctor to reveal the secrets of Dalek vulnerabilities in this interrogation session.}
{type: medium-term, description: To integrate the Doctor's knowledge into the Dalek programming, ensuring their future invincibility.}
{type: ultimate, description: To secure the Daleks' unchallenged dominion over the universe, fulfilling his vision of ultimate order and control.}

agent_participations.current_status: Strapped tightly into a cold metal chair, the Doctor is physically immobile, a captive audience to Davros's chilling demands. He sits upright, head held high despite his restraints, his bright blue eyes fixed on Davros with a mixture of defiance and profound sorrow. He is forced to listen, to speak, to betray his knowledge under duress, a prisoner in both body and conscience.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor is outwardly indignant and resistant, protesting the hijacking and interference. However, beneath this surface bravado, he is wrestling with deep moral anguish and despair. He feels the immense weight of responsibility, torn between his oath to protect the future and his immediate compassion for Sarah and Harry. His internal conflict is a storm of ethical turmoil, battling against Davros's calculated cruelty.
active_plans: To initially resist Davros's demands, hoping to stall or find an escape.
To protect Sarah and Harry from the threatened 'Pain Giver' at all costs.
To carefully choose his words, attempting to provide information while minimizing the damage to the future.
beliefs: Compassion and the protection of innocents are paramount, even at personal cost.
Knowledge, while powerful, must be wielded responsibly and ethically.
There is always hope for redemption, even in the face of overwhelming darkness, though despair threatens to engulf him.
goals: {type: short-term, description: To ensure the immediate safety and release of Sarah and Harry from Davros's threat.}
{type: medium-term, description: To limit the extent of the information Davros gains, mitigating the future impact on the universe.}
{type: ultimate, description: To find a way to ultimately thwart Davros's plans and prevent the Daleks from achieving universal dominance, despite the compromised situation.}

agent_participations.current_status: Harry is bound to a metal table, rendered utterly helpless and exposed in the stark interrogation room. He lies prone, his body tense with apprehension, electrodes affixed to his temples, making him a vulnerable pawn in Davros's cruel game. He is positioned as the Doctor's weak point, a silent, suffering presence meant to break the Time Lord's will.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Harry is deeply afraid and anxious, the threat of the 'Pain Giver' casting a dark shadow over him. Outwardly, he remains stoic and silent, enduring the terrifying ordeal with a stiff upper lip. Internally, he is intensely worried, not just for himself but for Sarah and the Doctor, his naval training battling against the raw fear of the unknown torture device.
active_plans: To remain silent and avoid provoking Davros or the guards.
To endure the implied threat of the 'Pain Giver', trusting the Doctor to find a solution.
To provide silent support to Sarah and the Doctor through his steadfast presence in this terrifying situation.
beliefs: Loyalty to his friends and comrades is unwavering, even in extreme peril.
The Doctor is resourceful and will find a way to overcome this challenge.
Courage and resilience are essential to survive such terrifying ordeals, though fear is a constant companion.
goals: {type: short-term, description: To survive the interrogation without succumbing to panic or betraying his friends.}
{type: medium-term, description: To escape the interrogation room and Davros's control, seeking safety and freedom.}
{type: ultimate, description: To return to safety and continue assisting the Doctor in his mission, hoping to leave Skaro and return to Earth eventually.}

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor, reluctantly under duress, recites a series of historical Dalek defeats, detailing specific instances where the Daleks failed in their attempts for domination, each answer a painful concession to Davros's demands.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor's surface emotions reflect deep resignation and despair, aware that his forced disclosures could empower an enemy. Internally, he grapples with the weight of his choices, torn between protecting his friends and the implications of revealing crucial weaknesses.
active_plans: To provide strategic vulnerabilities of the Daleks to save his friends from harm.
To gather information that could ultimately hinder the Daleks' future dominance.
To stall Davros's plans while hoping for a chance to thwart the Daleks.
beliefs: The belief that no creature should be exterminated without thorough consideration of the consequences.
The conviction that ethical dilemmas should guide his actions, even under duress.
A commitment to protect life wherever possible, even when faced with formidable evil.
goals: Short-term: To secure the safety of Harry and Sarah during the interrogation.
Medium-term: To gather enough information to halt the Daleks' production.
Ultimate: To destroy the Daleks and prevent their future reign of terror.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros remains in control, directing the interrogation and demanding information from the Doctor, satisfied with the prospect of using the Doctor's knowledge to enhance the Daleks' capabilities and secure his own position.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros exudes a cold confidence, driven by his obsession with the Daleks and a ruthless ambition to dominate, showing no remorse for the pain he inflicts on others. Beneath this exterior lies a deep-seated paranoia about losing power.
active_plans: To extract critical information from the Doctor regarding Dalek failures.
To ensure the Dalek production line continues without interruption.
To solidify his control over both his creations and the Kaled Elite.
beliefs: The conviction that the Daleks are the ultimate form of life, superior to all others.
The belief that his scientific genius justifies any actions taken in pursuit of power.
An unwavering faith in the necessity of violence and domination to achieve peace.
goals: Short-term: To gather and utilize the Doctor's knowledge for the Daleks' advantage.
Medium-term: To maintain control over the Kaled Elite and suppress dissent.
Ultimate: To ensure the Daleks become the supreme power in the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros, seated in his mobile chair, declares the interrogation concluded, his tone laced with satisfaction. He issues firm commands to Nyder regarding the prisoners and the crucial tape.  He then engages the Doctor in a seemingly amicable conversation, adopting a mentor-like posture, seeking further intellectual discourse now that he believes he has extracted the necessary information.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros exudes outward satisfaction and control, basking in the perceived success of extracting vital information from the Doctor. Internally, he is triumphant, convinced that this knowledge will solidify the Daleks' future dominance. There is no visible conflict, only a chilling sense of self-assuredness and superiority, bordering on megalomania, as he anticipates the enhanced power the tape will grant him.
active_plans: Secure the tape recording to prevent it from falling into the wrong hands.
Continue to engage the Doctor in conversation to glean any further insights or knowledge.
Prepare to program the Dalek memory banks with the newly acquired information to enhance their strategic capabilities.
beliefs: Knowledge is the ultimate weapon, and possessing information about Dalek weaknesses is strategically invaluable.
The Daleks are his ultimate creation and their success is paramount to his legacy.
He is intellectually superior to most, including the Doctor, and can manipulate situations to his advantage.
goals: short_term": "Ensure the tape recording is safely stored and under Nyder's absolute protection.
medium_term": "Utilize the information on the tape to refine and perfect the Daleks, eliminating their known weaknesses.
ultimate": "Guarantee the Daleks' unyielding dominance over all life in the universe, securing his own place in history as their creator.

agent_participations.current_status: Nyder acts with his characteristic efficiency and loyalty. He promptly releases Harry and Sarah from their restraints and directs soldiers to escort them back to detention. He receives the magnetic tape from Davros, acknowledging its importance with a serious demeanor and secures it as instructed, his movements precise and unquestioning.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Nyder is outwardly professional and obedient, his emotional state subdued, reflecting his unwavering loyalty to Davros. Internally, he is focused on executing Davros's commands without question, prioritizing security and efficiency.  There is no indication of personal emotion beyond a dutiful commitment to his leader's will, highlighting his role as a cold and pragmatic enforcer.
active_plans: Release Harry and Sarah from the interrogation equipment and ensure their safe return to the detention area.
Securely take possession of the magnetic tape from Davros.
Follow Davros's explicit instructions to safeguard the tape recording, recognizing its critical value to Davros's plans.
beliefs: Davros is the supreme authority and his commands are to be obeyed without hesitation.
Security and control are paramount, especially concerning valuable assets like the tape recording.
His duty is to serve Davros and ensure the success of his research, even through ruthless efficiency.
goals: short_term": "Execute Davros's orders precisely and efficiently, ensuring no lapse in security during the transfer and safekeeping of the tape.
medium_term": "Maintain Davros's trust and confidence by demonstrating unwavering loyalty and competence in handling sensitive tasks.
ultimate": "Contribute to the success of Davros's Dalek project and the establishment of Kaled/Dalek supremacy through diligent service and obedience.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor, initially slumped in defeat, listens as Davros expresses gratitude and shifts to a conversational tone. While appearing compliant and physically still, he subtly observes Davros and Nyder. He is released from his restraints and sits, ostensibly engaging in dialogue with Davros, though his internal focus remains on assessing the situation and formulating a counter-strategy.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor outwardly projects defeat and resignation, his voice flat, his posture slumped. Beneath this facade, a complex mix of emotions churns.  He feels immense regret and guilt for divulging critical information, yet a flicker of resilience remains. Internally, he is calculating and watchful, masking his true intentions while desperately seeking any opportunity to mitigate the damage he has unwillingly caused, his mind racing to find a new angle of attack.
active_plans: Appear compliant and defeated to lower Davros's guard and gain insight into his plans.
Observe Davros and Nyder closely to identify any potential weaknesses or vulnerabilities.
Mentally catalog and analyze the information he has revealed, searching for any way to minimize its impact or exploit unforeseen consequences.
beliefs: Even in dire situations, there is always a possibility for hope and strategic maneuvering.
Protecting his companions is paramount, even if it means personal sacrifice and temporary setbacks.
Knowledge, while powerful, is not absolute, and the future remains fluid and subject to change despite current circumstances.
goals: short_term": "Survive the immediate aftermath of the interrogation and avoid further torture or harm to himself and his companions.
medium_term": "Find a way to retrieve the tape recording and neutralize the threat posed by the information he was forced to reveal.
ultimate": "Prevent the Daleks from achieving universal domination and restore balance to the timeline, despite the serious setback he has encountered.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros exhibits manipulative cordiality, feigning camaraderie with the Doctor while masking his true intent to extract secrets.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros displays a facade of calm confidence, masking the underlying urgency and desperation to regain control over the situation and the Dalek project.
active_plans: Extract as much information from the Doctor as possible regarding Dalek weaknesses.
Reinforce his position of power by using the Doctor's knowledge to improve Dalek capabilities.
Maintain a facade of authority and trustworthiness to manipulate the scientists and security guards.
beliefs: The Daleks are the ultimate power and must be preserved and perfected.
He is superior to all others, including the Doctor, and therefore must not be questioned.
Sacrifice of his people is justified if it serves to create a more powerful Dalek race.
goals: Short-term: Extract vital information from the Doctor to enhance the Dalek project.
Medium-term: Suppress any opposition against his authority within the Elite.
Ultimate: Create a race of Daleks that will ensure his legacy and domination over the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor reluctantly shares critical information about Dalek defeats, facing the moral dilemma of betraying the future to protect his friends.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor experiences conflicting emotions of despair and resolve, battling against the sense of duty versus the devastating consequences of his knowledge.
active_plans: Provide enough information to satisfy Davros while finding a way to undermine his plans.
Ensure the safety of Harry and Sarah during the interrogation.
Seek an opportunity to escape and destroy the Dalek production line.
beliefs: Knowledge is a powerful weapon that must be used responsibly.
The future can be shaped by choices made in the present.
Even the most evil beings can be transformed if given a chance to recognize their flaws.
goals: Short-term: Protect Harry and Sarah during the interrogation.
Medium-term: Sabotage Davros's plans for the Daleks.
Ultimate: Ensure the Daleks do not become the destructive force they are destined to be.

agent_participations.current_status: Nyder stands by Davros, ready to enforce his master's will and maintain order, while secretly fearing losing power.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Nyder is tense and calculating, motivated by a need to maintain control and suppress any dissent against Davros's authority.
active_plans: Support Davros's efforts to extract information from the Doctor.
Ensure the loyalty of the security detail in the face of growing opposition.
Scout for potential threats to Davros's position and neutralize them.
beliefs: Loyalty to Davros is paramount for personal survival.
Violence and terror are necessary tools to maintain order.
Dissent must be crushed swiftly to prevent further rebellion.
goals: Short-term: Ensure that the interrogation of the Doctor goes as planned.
Medium-term: Quell any signs of insubordination among the scientists and guards.
Ultimate: Maintain his own position of power within the Kaled Elite.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The 'Pain Giver,' though unseen, is the linchpin of Davros's coercive strategy, its implied presence dominating the interrogation room. Davros chillingly references the device, threatening to unleash unimaginable agony upon Harry and Sarah should the Doctor refuse to cooperate. This threat, more than the device itself, is what forces the Doctor's hand, turning his compassion into a weapon against him. The 'Pain Giver' embodies Davros's ruthless pragmatism and the stark brutality of his methods, a psychological instrument of torture far more potent in its implied threat than any physical manifestation.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The 'Pain Giver' is assumed to be in operational readiness within the interrogation room, a standard tool available to Davros and his Elite for extracting information from recalcitrant subjects. Its location is within the interrogation facility, maintained by Davros's research group.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The 'Pain Giver' remains unused but symbolically potent within the interrogation room. Its status is unchanged physically, still a functional instrument of torture under Davros's control. Narratively, it has served its purpose, successfully coercing the Doctor through its implied threat, reinforcing its role as a symbol of fear and control in Davros's arsenal.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The Doctor recounts the Dalek invasion of Earth as an example of their failure, detailing how their overambitious attempt to mine the planet's core was thwarted, thereby exposing a critical vulnerability that could be used against them.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The event is a significant historical failure in the Dalek's catalog of attempts at conquest, still remembered and analyzed as part of the Doctor's warnings.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The event is solidified in the Dalek memory banks through the information provided by the Doctor, potentially informing future strategies.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The Doctor mentions the Dalek defeat on Mars due to a virus that targeted their electrical insulation, highlighting another technological weakness that could be exploited by their enemies, further emphasizing the Daleks' vulnerabilities.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The historical knowledge of this defeat serves as another example of Dalek shortcomings in the Doctor's memory, relevant to the ongoing interrogation.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: This example is recorded in the Dalek memory banks as part of the Doctor's coerced admissions, potentially aiding their future strategies unless acted upon.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: During his forced confession, the Doctor also details the Dalek war against the Venusian colonies, which was halted by a fleet of rockets from Hyperion, showcasing the failure of the Daleks when faced with superior technology.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: This engagement is recorded as part of historical Dalek defeats, serving as a critical lesson in their military strategies.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The war's outcome is catalogued in the Dalek memory, becoming a reference for future tactical assessments.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The tape recorder is essential for documenting the Doctor's confession, capturing all the strategic vulnerabilities he reluctantly shares with Davros, thereby becoming a pivotal tool in the ongoing power struggle.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The tape recorder is operational prior to the Doctor's disclosures, primed to record vital information of significant value.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: Following the Doctor's forced confessions, the tape recorder contains critical data that could ensure the Daleks' evolutionary progress if not destroyed.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The tape recording becomes the central focus of the event as Davros, deeming the interrogation successful, secures it. He explicitly instructs Nyder to safeguard it, emphasizing its 'priceless' nature and 'value beyond computation'. Davros removes the magnetic tape reel from the recorder and hands it to Nyder. The tape embodies the captured knowledge of Dalek weaknesses, transforming from a mere recording into a strategic asset of immense significance for Davros's future plans and the Daleks' potential dominance.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The tape recording is actively being created within the tape recorder, accumulating the Doctor's forced confessions during the interrogation session. It is in the process of becoming a repository of strategically vital information.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The tape recording is removed from the recorder and is now a secured artifact in Nyder's possession, under Davros's direct orders. It is elevated to a position of extreme importance, representing a significant intelligence victory for Davros and a potential turning point in the Daleks' evolution and future strategies.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The magnetic tape functions as the physical medium that carries the recorded information. While not directly manipulated by agents within the scene description, its presence is crucial as it is the component containing the Doctor's confessions. Davros removes the reel of magnetic tape from the recorder, indicating the tape itself, as distinct from the recording apparatus, is the object of value to be secured. Its involvement is passive yet essential as the storage device of critical intelligence.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The magnetic tape is inside the tape recorder, initially blank but actively recording the Doctor's forced testimony, its state transitioning from empty to information-rich.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The magnetic tape, now loaded with the Doctor's strategically valuable confession, is removed from the tape recorder as part of the secured 'tape recording' object. Its status shifts from a recording medium to a highly prized and dangerous artifact, embodying compromised knowledge.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The tape recording contains vital information extracted from the Doctor regarding the weaknesses of the Daleks, which Davros intends to integrate into their programming.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The tape recording is an untouched compilation of the Doctor's interrogation, housed securely within the safe in Davros's office.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The tape recording is destroyed by the Doctor, preventing any further use of the knowledge it contains by Davros.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The magnetic tape serves as the physical medium for the recordings made during the Doctor's interrogation, encapsulating the information that could enhance the Daleks.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The magnetic tape is safely stored within a secure safe, considered invaluable due to the information it contains.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The magnetic tape is rendered useless after the Doctor orders its destruction, eliminating the threat it poses.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Harry and Sarah are pushed inside. Sarah is caught by Gharman.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, thank you.
Who are you?
My name's Gharman.
Gharman?
Until a few hours ago I was head of the Military Elite Scientific Corps.
And now you're a prisoner like us? What happened?
Wait.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gharman listens at the door for a moment.

Dialogue.Line: I was trying to organise a movement against Davros. He found out. Now, what's happening out there? Has there been any attempt to take away control from Davros?
Not that we know of.
Nothing?
He's still very much in charge.
I don't understand. You see, Davros tricked me into giving him the names of the group who were plotting against him. Have there not been mass arrests by now? Executions?
It all seemed pretty quiet out there.
But Davros knows that we're planning action against him. Why hasn't he moved to stop it? Why?
Perhaps that'd be too obvious, even for Davros.
Well, if that's true, he's being too clever for his own good. Every moment he delays, our movement grows in strength.
I hope you're right.
I know I am. Many of us believe that production of the Daleks must end. I believe now that we are in the majority. If we act soon, we can break his power.
We're not in much of a position to act at the moment, are we.
If only I could get word to them now.

metadata.title: Prisoners of War
metadata.description: The scene unfolds in a stark and oppressive detention room where Harry and Sarah are unceremoniously pushed inside by guards. The atmosphere is tense, with a palpable sense of fear as they are met by Gharman, who introduces himself as a former head of the Military Elite Scientific Corps. The room is dimly lit, casting shadows that emphasize the starkness of their predicament. Gharman, despite being a prisoner himself, exhibits a flicker of hope as he discusses organizing a movement against Davros. The dread of Davros's oppressive control looms large, yet Gharman's resolve suggests a flicker of rebellion. The scene plays a crucial role in establishing the characters' motivations and the growing resistance against Davros's tyranny, highlighting the themes of oppression, hope, and the struggle for freedom.

events.title: Introduction of Gharman
events.description: As Harry and Sarah are pushed into the detention room, they are startled to find themselves confronted by Gharman, a tall, thin man who introduces himself as the former head of the Military Elite Scientific Corps. Gharman quickly assesses their situation and reveals that he has been trying to organize a movement against Davros, but now finds himself in a precarious position. The mood in the room is tense, underscored by a sense of impending danger from the outside world.
key_dialogue: My name's Gharman.
Until a few hours ago I was head of the Military Elite Scientific Corps.

events.title: Gharman's Dilemma
events.description: Gharman listens intently at the door, clearly afraid of what might happen next. He expresses confusion over Davros's lack of action regarding the movement against him, speculating that perhaps Davros is being too clever for his own good. Their conversation reveals Gharman's hope that their numbers are growing and that they still have a chance to break Davros's power. The tension builds as they realize the potential for rebellion against their oppressor.
key_dialogue: But Davros knows that we're planning action against him. Why hasn't he moved to stop it? Why?
I believe now that we are in the majority. If we act soon, we can break his power.

events.title: Plans for Rebellion
events.description: The mood in the room shifts as Gharman's optimism begins to swell. He articulates the desire among many of the prisoners to end the production of the Daleks. Their determination to act is palpable, but they remain helpless within the confines of the detention room. Harry expresses concern over their current predicament, questioning how they can initiate action while trapped. Gharman's frustration with the situation highlights the desperation of the prisoners, and the urgency of their plight.
key_dialogue: If only I could get word to them now.

agent_participations.current_status: Gharman is listening intently at the door, showing concern over the situation outside. He expresses confusion over Davros's lack of action against the movement, indicating he is strategizing and seeking clarity.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Gharman feels anxious and perplexed, reflecting a mix of determination and fear about the impending threat posed by Davros. He is hopeful yet uncertain about the support for a rebellion.
active_plans: To gather support among the Kaled Elite against Davros.
To understand Davros's intentions and why he hasn’t acted against the rebels.
To coordinate efforts with his allies to plan a rebellion.
beliefs: The Dalek project under Davros must be halted.
Unity among the Kaled Elite is essential for a successful revolt.
Davros is underestimating the growing strength of the resistance.
goals: Short-term: To organize a movement against Davros.
Medium-term: To rally enough support to confront Davros and halt the Dalek production.
Ultimate: To dismantle Davros's power and prevent the creation of the Daleks.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kavell walks up, with a cosh hidden behind his back.

Dialogue.Line: Halt! State your business.
I wish to question the prisoners.
Nobody is allowed to communicate with the prisoners unless they have a pass signed by Davros.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kavell steps forward, checking his pockets.

Dialogue.Line: Stay where you are!
I seem to have mislaid it. I'll come back later.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kavell walks away a few steps, stops, turns and runs at the soldier with the cosh.

metadata.title: Desperate Gambit
metadata.description: Outside the stark detention room, tension hangs heavy in the air. A lone, black-uniformed soldier stands guard, his rifle a stark reminder of the bunker's oppressive control. The sterile corridor, illuminated by harsh, functional lighting, offers no comfort or concealment. Kavell, a scientist known for his plump physique and seemingly harmless demeanor, approaches with a hidden cosh, his face a mask of forced casualness. He feigns a forgotten pass, attempting to lull the soldier into complacency. The air crackles with unspoken intent, a desperate gamble unfolding in the heart of the Kaled bunker. This brief scene functions as a critical turning point, highlighting the growing rebellion within Davros's ranks and setting the stage for direct confrontation. The thematic undercurrent is one of rising desperation and the courage found in unlikely heroes, as Kavell, the unassuming scientist, prepares to take a violent risk for a cause he believes in.

events.title: Suspicious Approach
events.description: Kavell, with a cosh concealed behind his back, cautiously approaches the soldier guarding the detention room. His movements are deliberately casual, attempting to project an air of routine and harmlessness.  The soldier, alert and professional, immediately demands Kavell state his purpose, creating a palpable sense of rising tension. Kavell's feigned nonchalance is a thin veil over his desperate plan, setting the stage for a potentially violent confrontation. This moment matters because it initiates the action of the scene, establishing Kavell's risky strategy and the soldier's unwavering vigilance.
key_dialogue: SOLDIER: Halt! State your business.
KAVELL: I wish to question the prisoners.

events.title: Demanding the Pass
events.description: The soldier, adhering strictly to protocol, insists on seeing a pass signed by Davros, blocking Kavell's seemingly innocuous request. This rigid adherence to rules underscores the oppressive atmosphere within the bunker and heightens the stakes for Kavell's deception. The soldier's unwavering stance serves as a significant obstacle, forcing Kavell to escalate his risky plan. This moment is crucial as it emphasizes the formal, controlled environment and the difficulty of operating outside of established procedures, even for those within Davros's own ranks.
key_dialogue: SOLDIER: Nobody is allowed to communicate with the prisoners unless they have a pass signed by Davros.

events.title: Feigned Forgetfulness
events.description: Kavell employs a tactic of feigned absentmindedness, pretending to search his pockets for the required pass. He uses this moment to subtly advance closer to the soldier, maintaining the facade of a harmless, slightly disorganised scientist.  This calculated hesitation is a crucial part of Kavell's deception, lulling the soldier into a false sense of security and creating an opening for his planned attack. The emotional progression is one of building tension, as Kavell's true intentions remain concealed beneath a veneer of bureaucratic incompetence.
key_dialogue: KAVELL: I seem to have mislaid it. I'll come back later.

events.title: Sudden Assault
events.description: In a swift and decisive move, Kavell abandons his pretense. He abruptly turns, then charges at the soldier, brandishing the cosh he had concealed. This sudden burst of violence shatters the deceptive calm of the scene, revealing Kavell's true desperation and intent. The soldier, caught off guard by Kavell's unexpected aggression, is left vulnerable. This is the climax of the scene, the pivotal moment where Kavell's gamble is put to the test. The emotional intensity peaks as the scene cuts abruptly, leaving the outcome of the struggle unresolved and heightening suspense.
key_dialogue: SOLDIER: Stay where you are!

agent_participations.current_status: Kavell approaches the soldier with casual yet deliberate movements, attempting to conceal the cosh behind his back while maintaining an air of routine.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Kavell exhibits a facade of calmness, masking his underlying anxiety and desperation. He is determined to execute his plan but is aware of the high stakes involved.
active_plans: To deceive the soldier guarding the detention room and gain access to the prisoners.
To implement a surprise attack against the soldier if necessary.
To gather intelligence from the prisoners that could aid his cause against Davros.
beliefs: The urgency of his mission justifies his deceptive tactics.
The prisoners hold valuable knowledge that can be leveraged against Davros.
Surprise and bold action are essential to overcoming the guards' vigilance.
goals: Short-term: Successfully pass through the guard without raising suspicion.
Medium-term: Obtain information from the prisoners about their plans and the Daleks.
Ultimate: Join the rebellion against Davros and halt the Dalek production.

agent_participations.current_status: The soldier stands rigidly at his post, alert and professional, demanding that Kavell state his business while firmly upholding security protocols.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The soldier displays a calm yet determined demeanor, embodying the vigilance and authority expected of a Kaled military guard. He feels a sense of duty to uphold the rules.
active_plans: To maintain strict security over the detention room.
To prevent unauthorized access to the prisoners and enforce protocol.
To report any suspicious behavior to his superiors.
beliefs: Adherence to security regulations is paramount for the protection of the Bunker.
Any deviation from protocol could lead to serious breaches in security.
His role as a soldier is to protect the interests of Davros and the Kaled government.
goals: Short-term: Ensure that no unauthorized personnel gain access to the prisoners.
Medium-term: Complete his shift without incident and report any suspicious activity.
Ultimate: Maintain the integrity and security of the Bunker against all threats.

agent_participations.current_status: Kavell approaches the detention room guard with a feigned air of routine, stating his intention to question the prisoners. He performs a pantomime of searching his pockets for the required pass, creating a false sense of disorganisation to mask his true intentions. His movements are calculated to appear non-threatening while subtly positioning himself for a potential confrontation.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Kavell displays surface calmness and professional demeanor, attempting to project an image of someone merely following standard procedure. Beneath this facade, he is undoubtedly tense and anxious. He understands the high stakes of his deception and is prepared to quickly shift to aggression if his ruse fails, revealing a conflict between his outward presentation and his underlying desperation.
active_plans: Gain immediate access to the detention room by deceiving the guard.
Assess the guard's compliance and vulnerability to manipulation.
Prepare to use physical force as a contingency if deception fails to bypass security protocol.
beliefs: Bureaucratic procedures can be exploited or circumvented with sufficient guile.
Initial displays of compliance can lower an opponent's guard.
Direct action becomes necessary when subtle approaches are blocked by rigid authority.
goals: short-term": "Convince the soldier to grant him access to the prisoners without a pass.
medium-term": "Communicate with the prisoners and advance the rebellion against Davros.
ultimate": "Contribute to the downfall of Davros and the dismantling of the Dalek project.

agent_participations.current_status: The soldier stands firm, blocking Kavell's path and rigidly enforcing protocol. He halts Kavell's approach and demands the presentation of a pass signed by Davros as the prerequisite for questioning prisoners. His posture is authoritative and unwavering, reflecting his dedication to security regulations and direct orders from superiors within the Kaled Bunker.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The soldier projects an outward demeanor of stern vigilance and unwavering adherence to duty. Internally, he is likely suspicious and focused on maintaining security. He shows no flexibility or empathy, prioritizing protocol above all else. His emotional state is defined by his commitment to order and suspicion of any deviation from established rules, revealing a rigid and unyielding mindset.
active_plans: Strictly enforce detention room access protocols.
Identify and prevent any unauthorized attempts to interact with prisoners.
Maintain a secure perimeter around the detention area as per standing orders.
beliefs: Adherence to protocol is paramount for maintaining order and security.
Any deviation from established procedures is a potential security threat.
Direct orders from Davros and established regulations are absolute and must be obeyed without question.
goals: short-term": "Verify Kavell's authorization by demanding to see the pass.
medium-term": "Prevent any unauthorized contact with the detention room prisoners.
ultimate": "Ensure the security and operational integrity of the Kaled Bunker, upholding his duty within the Elite Security forces.

agent_participations.current_status: Kavell approaches the soldier with a feigned air of confidence, pretending to search for his pass while actually preparing to use his hidden cosh to incapacitate the guard.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Kavell exhibits a facade of calmness and confidence, but underneath, he is anxious and aware of the high stakes involved in his deception. His heart races as he gets closer to attack.
active_plans: Lure the soldier into a false sense of security with a convincing act of forgetfulness.
Get close enough to incapacitate the guard without raising alarm.
Facilitate communication with the prisoners by breaching security.
beliefs: The ends justify the means when it comes to breaking free from Davros's control.
His scientific knowledge gives him a moral obligation to act against the Daleks.
He believes in the necessity of rebellion against Davros's tyranny.
goals: Short-term: Successfully incapacitate the guard to gain access to the prisoners.
Medium-term: Continue the rebellion against Davros by rallying support from other scientists.
Long-term: Overthrow Davros and end the Dalek project for good.

agent_participations.current_status: The soldier stands firm in his post, asserting security protocols and demanding proper identification while keeping a wary eye on Kavell's movements.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The guard displays confidence in his role, but there's an underlying tension as he senses Kavell's strange behavior. He remains alert, ready to respond to any threat.
active_plans: Enforce security protocols and deny unauthorized access to the prisoners.
Remain vigilant and ready to call for backup if Kavell attempts something suspicious.
Prevent any interaction that could compromise the security of the detention area.
beliefs: His duty is to uphold security measures as mandated by Davros's orders.
Only authorized personnel should interact with the prisoners, ensuring strict adherence to protocol.
He believes in the importance of his role in maintaining order within the Bunker.
goals: Short-term: Successfully enforce security against unauthorized personnel.
Medium-term: Maintain the integrity of the detention room and the safety of the prisoners.
Long-term: Be recognized as a loyal and diligent soldier within the ranks of Davros's Elite.

agent_participations.current_status: Kavell, initially feigning a search for a misplaced pass, abruptly pivots from his deceptive stance. He charges directly at the soldier, his hidden cosh now brandished menacingly. This sudden shift from compliance to aggression catches the guard completely off guard as Kavell initiates a physical assault to overcome the security.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Beneath a veneer of feigned forgetfulness and politeness, Kavell is driven by a simmering desperation and a resolute intent to overcome the soldier's vigilance. He channels his anxiety into a decisive, if risky, physical confrontation, revealing a suppressed urgency to proceed with his plan, masking his true violent intention under a guise of civilian harmlessness.
active_plans: Incapacitate the soldier swiftly to bypass security.
Gain unauthorized access to the detention room.
Advance the rebellion against Davros by freeing or contacting prisoners (implied).
beliefs: Resorting to physical force is justified when deception fails to achieve necessary objectives.
Davros and his loyalists must be actively resisted to prevent further atrocities.
The ends justify the means in the struggle against Davros's tyranny.
goals: Short-term Goal: To disable the soldier guarding the detention room.
Medium-term Goal: To infiltrate the detention area and potentially free imprisoned allies.
Ultimate Goal: To contribute to the broader rebellion aimed at dismantling Davros's regime and the Dalek project.

agent_participations.current_status: The soldier stands rigidly, embodying protocol and vigilance. He firmly halts Kavell, demanding proper authorization for entry. Alert and suspicious, he maintains his post, weapon ready, ensuring no breach of security occurs. His stance is one of unwavering duty, positioned to prevent any unauthorized access to the detention area under his watch.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Initially, the soldier exudes a detached authority, focused on procedural correctness and maintaining order.  Surprise and alarm quickly overtake him as Kavell's feigned compliance shatters into aggressive action. He is caught off guard, transitioning from routine vigilance to a state of immediate threat and the urgent need to defend his position and himself against unexpected physical violence.
active_plans: Maintain strict security protocols at the detention room entrance.
Demand and verify authorization from anyone seeking access.
React defensively to any perceived threat or breach of security, including physical force.
beliefs: Adherence to security protocols is paramount for maintaining order and preventing breaches.
Any deviation from established procedure should be treated with suspicion and firmness.
Physical force is a legitimate and necessary response to threats against security.
goals: Short-term Goal: To rigorously enforce access control by demanding proper identification.
Medium-term Goal: To prevent any unauthorized individuals from entering the detention room.
Ultimate Goal: To uphold the overall security and order within the Bunker as part of his assigned duties.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The 'pass' is not physically present but is invoked by the soldier as a necessary bureaucratic instrument controlling access to the detention room. It functions as a verbal obstacle, a checkpoint in the narrative that highlights the rigid, protocol-driven environment of the Kaled Bunker. The soldier's demand for the pass serves to immediately thwart Kavell's initial, seemingly legitimate request, forcing Kavell to improvise and escalate his actions beyond mere deception.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: Hypothetically required for accessing restricted areas within the Bunker, assumed to be under the control and issuance of Davros or his direct administration, symbolizing hierarchical authority.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: Remains hypothetical and unproduced; its absence serves as the catalyst for conflict escalation, revealing the inflexibility of the security system and propelling Kavell toward a more forceful approach when his initial deception is blocked by the pass requirement.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: The cosh, initially hidden and representing Kavell's concealed intention to use force, becomes the central instrument of his sudden assault. Kavell brandishes it to strike the soldier, aiming to incapacitate him and overcome his physical resistance to gain entry. This act transforms the cosh from a secret tool into a weapon of direct confrontation, embodying the abrupt escalation of the scene from deceptive calm to violent struggle.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: The cosh is concealed, hidden within Kavell's person, unknown to the soldier and unseen by anyone else. It is in a state of potential energy, representing Kavell's readiness to resort to violence if necessary, but not yet actively deployed.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: The cosh is brandished and actively used as a weapon in Kavell's charge. Its status shifts from concealed to exposed and active, becoming the focal point of the physical conflict. Its effectiveness in incapacitating the soldier and its immediate impact on the scene remain unresolved as the scene ends abruptly, heightening the suspense.

Dialogue.Line: Now, future errors will be eradicated. Defeats will become victories. You have changed the future of the universe, Doctor.
I have betrayed the future. Davros, for the last time, consider what you're doing. Stop the development of the Daleks.
Impossible. It is beyond my control. The workshops are already fully automated to produce the Dalek machines.
It's not the machines, it's the minds of the creatures inside them. Minds that you created. They are totally evil.

Evil? No. No, I will not accept that. They are conditioned simply to survive. They can survive only by becoming the dominant species. When all other life forms are suppressed, when the Daleks are the supreme rulers of the universe, then you will have peace. Wars will end. They are the power not of evil, but of good.
Davros, if you had created a virus in your laboratory, something contagious and infectious that killed on contact, a virus that would destroy all other forms of life, would you allow its use?
It is an interesting conjecture.
Would you do it?
The only living thing, a microscopic organism reigning supreme. A fascinating idea.
But would you do it?

Yes. Yes. To hold in my hand a capsule that contains such power, to know that life and death on such a scale was my choice. To know that the tiny pressure on my thumb, enough to break the glass, would end everything. Yes, I would do it! That power would set me up above the gods. And through the Daleks, I shall have that power!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor grabs Davros' raised arm, and they wrestle.

Dialogue.Line: Release me.
No, Davros.
Don't touch that switch.
Why not?
It controls my life support systems. I could not survive thirty seconds without them.
Order the destruction of the incubator section.
Destroy the Daleks? Never. (The Doctor presses the little black switch, and an alarm goes off. Davros starts to crumple. The Doctor presses it again and he revives.)
I mean it, Davros. Next time I press that switch, it stays pressed. Now give the order!
Even if I do this, there will be no escape for you.
I'll take that chance. Now give the order.
Press the communicator switch.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor does so.

Dialogue.Line: This is Davros. Elite unit seven will go to the incubator room. All survival maintenance systems are to be closed down. The Dalek creatures are to be destroyed.
Tell them the order cannot be countermanded.
This order cannot...

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyder coshes the Doctor.

Dialogue.Line: This is Davros, this is Davros. My last order is cancelled, repeat, cancelled. No action is to be taken.
What do you want done with this?
For the moment he must be kept alive. He has knowledge that is vital to our future, and I will drain every last detail of it from his mind. And then, he will learn the true meaning of pain.
I will take him to the detention room.
The dissidents. What progress are they making?
Feeling against you is rising. Many of the scientific corps are openly speaking against you. Even some of the military are joining them.
As I expected.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor wakes, unnoticed.

Dialogue.Line: They will take action soon?
Almost certainly. They outnumber those of us who are loyal. Davros, why don't you let me take a squad of Elite men I can trust? In an hour, I could wipe out their leaders.
You think like a soldier, Nyder. Rebellion is an idea in the mind. Suppress it, and it hides away and festers. No. My way is best.
As you wish. On your feet!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Nyder takes the Doctor out of the room.

Dialogue.Line: All Dalek units! All Dalek units!

metadata.title: The Interrogation of Davros
metadata.description: In the dimly lit interrogation room, tension hangs thick in the air as Davros, the twisted mastermind behind the Daleks, faces off against the Doctor. The sterile environment is filled with the hum of machinery and the cold glare of lights reflecting off metal surfaces. Davros’s wheelchair is a mechanical marvel, and he exudes an aura of menace, his voice dripping with arrogance as he discusses the fate of the Daleks. The Doctor, bound in a chair, struggles with the moral implications of his actions as they engage in a battle of wits—a true clash of ideologies. The stakes rise dramatically when the Doctor realizes the lives of his friends depend on his next words, leading to a desperate struggle for control over the future.

events.title: Davros's Menace
events.description: Davros reveals his vision for the Daleks, arguing that they are not evil, but a necessary force for survival. The Doctor counters, attempting to persuade Davros to stop the Dalek program by highlighting the inherent evil within the creatures he has created. A tense dialogue ensues as the Doctor grapples with the morality of destroying the Daleks versus the potential future they represent.
key_dialogue: Now, future errors will be eradicated. Defeats will become victories. You have changed the future of the universe, Doctor.
I have betrayed the future. Davros, for the last time, consider what you're doing. Stop the development of the Daleks.
It is an interesting conjecture.
Would you do it?

events.title: The Doctor's Desperation
events.description: As the discussion escalates, the Doctor's frustration peaks. He grabs Davros's raised arm in a desperate attempt to control the situation. The two engage in a physical struggle, revealing the Doctor's determination to prevent further Dalek creation. Davros threatens the Doctor by indicating that his life support system is in the Doctor's hands, further intensifying the stakes of their confrontation.
key_dialogue: Release me.
No, Davros.
Why not?
It controls my life support systems. I could not survive thirty seconds without them.

events.title: Davros's Commands
events.description: The Doctor's manipulation of the situation takes a turn as he gains temporary control over Davros's commands. He insists that Davros issue orders for the destruction of the Dalek incubator section, putting Davros in a position where he must choose between his creations and his own survival. This moment of power highlights the tension between creator and creation, as Davros is forced to acknowledge the consequences of his actions.
key_dialogue: Order the destruction of the incubator section.
Destroy the Daleks? Never.

events.title: The Interruption
events.description: Before the Doctor can press the advantage, Nyder interrupts the confrontation, coshing the Doctor and regaining control. Davros reflects on the need to maintain his authority, even in the face of rebellion. The tension in the room escalates as Nyder takes the Doctor away, leaving Davros to ponder his next move against the dissenting scientists.
key_dialogue: What do you want done with this?
For the moment he must be kept alive.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros argues passionately about the necessity of the Daleks as a force for good, believing their dominance will bring peace. He remains seated in his chair, displaying confidence and a sense of superiority.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros exhibits a resolute and fanatical conviction in his beliefs. He is dismissive of the Doctor's warnings, showing no remorse for the evil he perpetuates, instead reveling in his vision of conquest.
active_plans: To persuade the Doctor of the righteousness of his cause regarding the Daleks.
To assert his authority over the Daleks and ensure their production continues without interruption.
To manipulate the situation to maintain his power within the Kaled Elite.
beliefs: The Daleks are a necessary force for survival and ultimately for good.
True peace can only be achieved through dominance and suppression of other life forms.
His vision for the Daleks represents a higher form of scientific achievement.
goals: Short-term: To convince the Doctor to accept the Daleks as necessary.
Medium-term: To continue the production of Daleks without interference.
Ultimate: To establish the Daleks as the supreme rulers of the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor, bound to a chair, wrestles with Davros over the morality of destroying the Daleks. He asserts his belief that the Daleks are inherently evil, desperately trying to convince Davros to stop their production.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor experiences a profound sense of sorrow and conflict. He grapples with his role as a protector of life while facing the grim reality of the Daleks and the threat they pose to the universe.
active_plans: To persuade Davros to halt the Dalek program.
To gain information about the Daleks' weaknesses.
To protect his friends from Davros's malevolence.
beliefs: The Daleks, while powerful, represent a fundamental evil that must be stopped.
Every life has value, and the destruction of an entire species must not be taken lightly.
Sometimes difficult moral choices must be made for the greater good.
goals: Short-term: To avoid revealing critical information about the future.
Medium-term: To convince Davros to abandon his plans for the Daleks.
Ultimate: To destroy the Daleks and prevent the suffering they will cause.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros, seated in his mobile life support chair, raises his arm in a gesture of dominance, engaging in a physical struggle with the Doctor who has grabbed his arm. He emphasizes his control over the Doctor's fate through the life support switch, asserting his power in this tense confrontation within the interrogation room.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros is initially arrogant and convinced of his intellectual and moral superiority, gloating about the Daleks' future victories and dismissing the Doctor's moral objections as mere sentimentality. However, when the Doctor turns the tables by threatening his life support, a flicker of fear and desperation underlies his usual cold demeanor, revealing his dependence on the very technology he champions.
active_plans: To extract every detail about Dalek weaknesses from the Doctor's future knowledge.
To assert his dominance over the Doctor, breaking his will and forcing compliance.
To proceed with the Dalek project unimpeded, ensuring their creation and future dominance despite any opposition.
beliefs: The Daleks represent the pinnacle of evolution and the only path to universal order and peace.
Compassion and conscience are weaknesses that must be purged for survival and progress.
His own vision for the Daleks is inherently good, justifying any means necessary to achieve their dominance.
goals: Short-term: To force the Doctor to divulge crucial information about Dalek vulnerabilities.
Medium-term: To refine and perfect the Daleks, ensuring their invincibility based on the Doctor's revelations.
Ultimate: To establish the Daleks as the supreme power in the universe, ushering in an era of enforced peace under their rule.

agent_participations.current_status: Frustrated and desperate, the Doctor physically grabs Davros's raised arm, initiating a struggle to disrupt Davros's control and prevent further Dalek creation. He confronts Davros directly, attempting to reason with him and ultimately resorting to threatening Davros's life support systems in a last-ditch effort to halt the project.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor is torn between his deep-seated abhorrence for the Daleks and his moral reservations about taking a life, even Davros's.  His frustration is palpable as he argues with Davros, his desperation growing as he contemplates the terrible future he is trying to avert. Beneath the surface of his forceful actions lies a profound sadness and the heavy weight of the ethical dilemma he faces.
active_plans: To convince Davros through reason and moral argument to abandon the Dalek project.
To intimidate Davros by threatening to disable his life support, hoping to force compliance.
To order Davros to shut down the Dalek incubator section, taking direct action to halt their creation, even if momentarily.
beliefs: The Daleks are an unmitigated evil that must be prevented from existing or expanding their influence.
All life is precious, and taking a life, even to prevent greater evil, is a grave moral decision.
There is still a chance to appeal to Davros's humanity, however deeply buried it may be.
goals: Short-term: To compel Davros to order the immediate destruction of the Dalek incubator section.
Medium-term: To permanently halt the development and production of the Daleks on Skaro.
Ultimate: To safeguard the universe from the Dalek menace, preserving life and freedom across time and space.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros remains resolute in his refusal to halt Dalek production, arguing that the creations are necessary for the survival of the Kaled race. He attempts to manipulate the Doctor while maintaining a facade of authority and control over the situation.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros shows a mixture of confidence and arrogance, underpinned by a deep-seated fear of losing his creations. His obsession with power leads him to dismiss the Doctor's warnings, fully believing in his own infallibility.
active_plans: Continue the automated production of Daleks without interruption.
Convince the Doctor that the Daleks are essential for peace.
Maintain control over his creations and eliminate any dissenting voices.
beliefs: Survival of the fittest is paramount; his creations must dominate.
Power justifies any means, including the destruction of his own race.
The Daleks embody a new evolution that should not be impeded.
goals: Short-term: Ensure the continuation of Dalek production.
Medium-term: Gain control over the scientific Elite and suppress opposition.
Ultimate: Establish Daleks as the supreme rulers of the universe.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor engages Davros in a high-stakes confrontation, utilizing clever manipulation to gain temporary control over Davros's commands. He wrestles with the moral implications of his choices while attempting to prevent the continuation of the Dalek project.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor feels a complex blend of determination and despair. He battles guilt over the future consequences of his actions, yet maintains a flicker of hope that he can find a way to stop Davros and save lives.
active_plans: Force Davros to issue orders for the destruction of the Daleks.
Manipulate the conversation to gain leverage over Davros.
Find a way to sabotage the Dalek production before it's too late.
beliefs: The preservation of life and moral integrity outweighs the potential power of the Daleks.
Every creature has the capacity for good; even the Daleks could be reformed.
Intervening in the timeline must be balanced with the moral implications of such actions.
goals: Short-term: Secure the destruction of the incubator section.
Medium-term: Prevent the Daleks from becoming a dominant force.
Ultimate: Ensure a future free from the tyranny of the Daleks.

agent_participations.current_status: Nyder bursts into the interrogation room, blaster in hand, his uniform dishevelled and his usual cold composure replaced by terror. He acts decisively, coshing the Doctor from behind with a truncheon to regain control of the situation after the Doctor's brief moment of dominance over Davros. He then forcibly removes the Doctor from the room, taking him to the detention cells.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Nyder is primarily driven by fear and a desperate need to reassert control. His outward terror contrasts sharply with his usual coldness, revealing a vulnerability beneath his authoritarian exterior.  Internally, he is conflicted, loyal to Davros yet panicked by the rising rebellion and the Doctor's temporary upper hand. He feels responsible for maintaining order and Davros's authority.
active_plans: Neutralize the immediate threat posed by the Doctor's temporary control over Davros.
Regain physical control of the Doctor and remove him from Davros's presence.
Report to Davros on the escalating dissent and seek further instructions on how to suppress the rebellion within the Kaled Elite.
beliefs: Davros's authority must be absolute and unchallenged to ensure stability.
Force and decisive action are the most effective tools for maintaining order.
Dissent and rebellion are significant threats that must be crushed swiftly and completely to protect Davros's vision.
goals: Short-term: Subdue the Doctor and prevent him from further influencing Davros.
Medium-term: Assist Davros in suppressing the growing rebellion among the Kaled Elite.
Ultimate: Secure Davros's power and ensure the successful development and deployment of the Daleks as the dominant force on Skaro.

agent_participations.current_status: The Doctor is initially pressing his advantage, holding a precarious control over Davros by threatening to cut off his life support. He is physically engaged, hand raised near the life support controls, demanding Davros order the destruction of the Dalek incubator. However, his physical dominance is abruptly ended when Nyder coshes him from behind, leaving him unconscious and captive once more.
agent_participations.emotional_state: The Doctor is driven by a fierce determination to prevent the Daleks' creation, experiencing a brief surge of hope as he gains leverage over Davros.  Beneath this outward resolve, there's a deep weariness and moral conflict, evident in his desperate plea for Davros to reconsider. His hope is dashed by Nyder's sudden attack, leaving him frustrated and physically subdued, yet his inner resolve remains unbroken.
active_plans: Force Davros to order the destruction of the Dalek incubator, thus preventing the Daleks' genesis.
Exploit Davros's physical vulnerability to compel him to make a morally sound decision.
Appeal to Davros's rationality, however twisted, in a last-ditch effort to avert universal catastrophe, even if it means a morally questionable action.
beliefs: The Daleks represent an unmitigated evil that must be prevented at all costs.
Even the most ruthless beings might be swayed by direct, personal threats when their own survival is at stake.
Moral responsibility sometimes necessitates difficult choices, even if they involve methods that are typically against his principles.
goals: Short-term: Coerce Davros into halting the Dalek project through direct threat.
Medium-term: Eliminate the immediate threat of the Dalek's creation on Skaro.
Ultimate: Prevent the Daleks from ever becoming a universal menace, safeguarding countless future lives and maintaining the balance of the cosmos.

agent_participations.current_status: Davros is initially on the defensive, physically threatened by the Doctor and forced to issue a command to destroy the Dalek incubator under duress. However, his position shifts dramatically when Nyder intervenes, restoring Davros's control. He reassumes his dominant posture, dismissing the rebellion as an insignificant 'idea' and reaffirming his commitment to his Dalek project.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros displays a chilling blend of fear and calculated manipulation. Initially threatened and vulnerable, he quickly reverts to arrogance and self-assurance once Nyder intervenes.  Beneath the surface, there's a deep-seated paranoia and a desperate need to maintain control, fueled by his megalomaniacal vision. He shows contempt for the dissidents and a chilling detachment from morality, focused solely on his ambition.
active_plans: Regain complete control of the situation after being momentarily threatened by the Doctor.
Use Nyder's intervention to reassert his dominance and reverse the Doctor's coercion.
Minimize the significance of the rebellion, dismissing it as a minor obstacle in his grand scheme, while secretly planning its suppression.
beliefs: The Daleks are the ultimate expression of Kaled evolution and the only path to universal peace through dominance.
He is intellectually and strategically superior to everyone else, including the Doctor and the dissenting scientists.
Emotional considerations like conscience and pity are weaknesses that must be eradicated for true progress and survival.
goals: Short-term: Overcome the immediate threat posed by the Doctor and re-establish his authority.
Medium-term: Suppress the growing rebellion and consolidate his power within the Kaled Elite.
Ultimate: Achieve universal Dalek supremacy, fulfilling his twisted vision of galactic order and solidifying his legacy as the creator of the ultimate life form.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The slaughter continues. One Dalek approaches another.

Dialogue.Line: Davros has commanded all Dalek units to disengage and return to the bunker immediately. DALEK 2: I obey.

metadata.title: Recall to Bunker
metadata.description: Within the Thal Dome city, the chilling efficiency of the Dalek extermination continues. The air is thick with the echoes of gunfire and the unseen suffering of the city's inhabitants.  Despite the ongoing massacre, a sudden shift occurs as a Dalek unit receives a direct command from Davros. This abrupt recall, delivered amidst the chaos, hints at a calculated change in Davros's strategy, pulling his forces back from the brutal front lines to an unknown purpose within the Bunker. The scene underscores the terrifying power and absolute obedience of the Daleks, even in the midst of their violent purpose, and marks a pivot in the narrative's direction.

events.title: Dalek Extermination Continues
events.description: The brutal efficiency of the Dalek assault on the Thal city is laid bare.  Dalek units relentlessly pursue and eliminate any Thals in their path, their actions driven by an unwavering and merciless directive. This chilling continuation of the slaughter establishes the Daleks as forces of absolute destruction, devoid of compassion and single-mindedly focused on extermination. The scene serves to amplify the horror of the Dalek threat and the desperate situation facing the Thals.

events.title: Recall Order from Davros
events.description: Abruptly halting the ongoing slaughter, one Dalek receives and relays a recall command directly from Davros. This unexpected order signals a significant shift in the Daleks' mission.  The Dalek units, previously engaged in extermination, immediately cease their attack and prepare to disengage, demonstrating their absolute obedience to Davros's directives. This pivotal moment suggests a calculated change of plans by Davros, drawing his forces back from the city for reasons yet unknown, adding a layer of suspense and anticipation to the narrative.
key_dialogue: DALEK: Davros has commanded all Dalek units to disengage and return to the bunker immediately.
DALEK 2: I obey.

agent_participations.current_status: The Dalek units are actively pursuing Thals throughout the city, exhibiting their relentless and efficient extermination protocols. They glide through the streets, firing their weapons without hesitation, leaving destruction in their wake.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Being mechanical entities, the Daleks display no emotions; their single-minded focus on extermination reflects their programmed loyalty to Davros. This cold efficiency evokes horror in the Thals, amplifying the sense of danger.
active_plans: To identify and eliminate any Thal life forms encountered in their path.
To follow the directives given by Davros without question, maintaining a strategy of total destruction.
To return to the bunker upon receiving the command from Davros, ensuring a strategic redeployment.
beliefs: They are superior to all non-Dalek life forms and exist to exterminate inferior beings.
Their actions are justifiable as they follow the orders of Davros, their creator.
Their existence is a necessary component of maintaining order in the universe through extermination.
goals: Short-term: Complete the extermination of the Thal population in the city.
Medium-term: Re-establish control in the bunker and prepare for future operations.
Ultimate: Achieve universal dominance and eliminate all threats to Dalek existence.

agent_participations.current_status: Upon receiving the recall order, this Dalek immediately ceases its extermination activities. It stands motionless amidst the carnage of the Thal city, its gun arm lowered, momentarily pausing its relentless assault. It then turns to its fellow Dalek unit to relay the command, its casing still gleaming menacingly in the dim light of the devastated city.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Devoid of any discernible emotion, the Dalek operates purely on programmed directives. There is no indication of surprise, curiosity, or any other feeling in its mechanical actions or vocalizations. Its focus is solely on the execution of Davros's command, displaying cold, unwavering obedience without question or hesitation.
active_plans: Receive and process Davros's recall command.
Relay the recall order to other Dalek units in the field.
Prepare for immediate disengagement from the extermination of Thals and return to the Bunker.
beliefs: Absolute obedience to Davros is paramount.
Dalek directives must be executed without question or deviation.
Current extermination mission is superseded by Davros's new command.
goals: Short-term: Effectively communicate the recall order to all necessary Dalek units.
Medium-term: Ensure all Dalek units promptly cease their extermination efforts and begin withdrawal.
Ultimate: Facilitate Davros's strategic objectives, whatever they may be, through unwavering obedience and efficient command execution.

agent_participations.current_status: Engaged in the systematic extermination of Thals within the dome city, this Dalek abruptly halts its actions upon receiving the recall message. It stands amidst the fallen bodies, its weapon momentarily stilled, acknowledging the new directive with immediate compliance. It prepares to disengage from the ongoing slaughter to follow Davros's unexpected orders.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Functioning solely on pre-programmed directives, this Dalek exhibits no emotional response to the sudden shift in mission. Its actions are purely mechanical and obedient, devoid of personal volition or feeling. There is no hesitation or curiosity, only instant adaptation to the new command, showcasing its nature as a tool of war.
active_plans: Receive and acknowledge the recall command from the prototype Dalek.
Immediately cease all extermination activities within the Thal city.
Prepare for rapid redeployment and return to the designated location at the Bunker, as per Davros's orders.
beliefs: Davros is the ultimate authority and must be obeyed without question.
Dalek units operate as a collective, responding uniformly to command.
The current objective, though seemingly a reversal, is strategically sound under Davros's command.
goals: Short-term:  Completely halt extermination and await further instructions.
Medium-term: Efficiently redeploy to the Bunker, ready for the next phase of Davros's plan.
Ultimate: Contribute to the Daleks' overall mission of galactic dominance through unwavering obedience and efficient execution of orders.

agent_participations.current_status: From within the secure Bunker, Davros issues a cold, calculated recall order, abruptly ceasing the Dalek's slaughter in the Thal dome. He remains positioned in the laboratory, orchestrating events from afar, his withered hand hovering over the controls of his life-support chair, ensuring his creations are brought back under his direct influence for his next strategic move.
agent_participations.emotional_state: Davros displays a veneer of detached control, masking a mind constantly strategizing and manipulating. While outwardly calm, there's an undercurrent of calculated ruthlessness and strategic intent. He is driven by a desire to maintain absolute authority over the Daleks and the unfolding situation, even if it means abruptly altering his previously established extermination plans.
active_plans: Reassert control over the Dalek units after their deployment in the Thal city.
Consolidate Dalek forces back at the Bunker for an undisclosed strategic purpose.
Maintain an element of surprise and unpredictability in his plans to keep his enemies off balance.
beliefs: The Daleks are extensions of his will and must be completely obedient.
Strategic flexibility and unpredictable command changes are key to victory.
He is the ultimate mastermind, capable of outmaneuvering any opposition through calculated decisions.
goals: Short-term: Successfully recall all Dalek units from the Thal dome without resistance.
Medium-term: Reposition and prepare the Dalek forces for a new, undisclosed phase of his grand plan.
Ultimate: Secure his vision of Dalek supremacy and his own dominant role in shaping the destiny of Skaro and beyond.

object_involvements.description_of_involvement: Davros's recall command is the pivotal object in this event, functioning as a directive broadcast to the Dalek units. It serves as the catalyst that halts the ongoing Thal extermination, compelling the Daleks to abruptly cease their attack and initiate a return to the Bunker. This command showcases Davros's absolute control over the Daleks and his capacity to instantly alter their mission parameters, fundamentally shifting the narrative's momentum and raising questions about his ultimate strategy.
object_involvements.object_status_before_event: Non-existent; prior to this moment, Davros has not issued any recall order, and the Daleks are actively engaged in extermination.
object_involvements.object_status_after_event: Executed and in effect; the command has been successfully transmitted and received by the Daleks, who are now in the process of disengaging from the Thal city and commencing their return to the Bunker, signifying a major shift in their operational status.

Dialogue.Line: Shush. There's something moving out there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sevrin enters, out of breath.

Dialogue.Line: The whole of the Thal city is burning. The Daleks are moving through it, section by section, hunting down the survivors.
Then there's no one left?
No, I covered a fairly large area and found no one. No one living, that is.
So we're on our own.
You're still going to attack the main entrance though, aren't you?
There's no point in delaying any longer. We'll move more safely under the cover of darkness. Come on, get ready, we're moving out.

metadata.title: The Last Stand in the Trenches
metadata.description: In the barren wasteland of the trenches, thrumming with the echoes of destruction, Bettan and Sevrin convene amid the remains of a fallen city. The air is thick with tension, punctuated by distant screams and the crackle of gunfire as the Daleks sweep through the remnants of the Thal city, exterminating any survivors. Sevrin's arrival is urgent, his breathless words painting a grim picture of the devastation. Bettan, filled with resolve, understands the grim reality—they are alone now, with only their courage to drive them forward. With no survivors left to rally and the Dalek threat looming large, she steels herself for the impending attack on the main entrance, determined to strike under the cover of darkness. As they prepare to mobilize their small band, a shared understanding of the stakes weighs heavily upon them.

events.title: Bettan and Sevrin Assess the Situation
events.description: Bettan and Sevrin find themselves in the remains of the Thal city, which is engulfed in flames and chaos.
