objects.significance: Represents both an obstacle and a potential escape route

objects.name: Etheric Beam Locator
objects.description: A seemingly innocuous piece of advanced technology from the Doctor's collection, indicative of his alien origins. It is mentioned as being handed to Harry along with the sonic screwdriver.
objects.purpose: Implied scientific function, unknown specific purpose in this scene
objects.significance: Part of the Doctor's inventory that underscores his resourcefulness and alien technology

objects.name: Spare Parts Requisition List
objects.description: A document produced by Nyder detailing supply requirements for the bunker, countersigned by Davros. It carries significant authority and overrides standard military supply priorities.
objects.purpose: Requisitioning supplies for the bunker
objects.significance: Demonstrates Davros's authority and resource control within the Kaled society

objects.name: Magnifying Glass
objects.description: A magnifying glass used by Nyder to examine the Doctor's etheric beam locator, highlighting his meticulous nature and the technological disparity between him and the Doctor.
objects.purpose: Examination of small objects
objects.significance: Highlights Nyder's attention to detail and underlying suspicion

objects.name: Console
objects.description: A technological interface in the Bunker's security area, equipped with buttons and a microphone, serving as the central control panel for security operations.
objects.purpose: Manage security operations and access control
objects.significance: Represents a control point within the facility

objects.name: Microphone
objects.description: A microphone integrated into the console of the Bunker's security area, used for voice communication to manage security announcements and commands.
objects.purpose: Voice communication within the security setup
objects.significance: Key component of the facility's security protocol

objects.name: Door Control Button
objects.description: A button on the security console that controls the operation of the steel doors in the Bunker, allowing Tane to open them for the escort of prisoners.
objects.purpose: Control operation of secure steel doors
objects.significance: Crucial for access control within the facility

objects.name: Steel Doors
objects.description: Heavy, secure metal doors at the entrance of the Bunker's security area, designed to control access and ensure inner facility protection through automated operation.
objects.purpose: Serve as a robust security barrier
objects.significance: Symbolize controlled access and high levels of security

objects.name: Plastic Box
objects.description: A container used to store confiscated belongings of prisoners, including the Doctor's etheric beam locator, indicating a systematic approach to security and control.
objects.purpose: Storage of confiscated items
objects.significance: Represents security procedures and the cataloging of personal effects

objects.name: Cup of Tea
objects.description: A requested refreshment symbolizing the Doctor's characteristic British levity in dire circumstances, though his request is quickly dismissed by military protocol.
objects.purpose: Refreshment (requested, not provided)
objects.significance: Infuses humor and cultural contrast into the tense situation

objects.name: Security Scan
objects.description: A technological procedure conducted in the Bunker's security area involving a body scanner that emits a humming sound and causes discomfort, designed to detect threats and unauthorized items.
objects.purpose: Threat detection and individual identification
objects.significance: Embodies the advanced security measures and surveillance in use

objects.name: Body Scanner
objects.description: A large, upright scanning device located in the Bunker's security area. Featuring two large chest-height boxes and emitting a humming sound, it detects hidden objects and analyzes physical composition.
objects.purpose: Security screening
objects.significance: Represents advanced technological surveillance and security

objects.name: Power Source
objects.description: The energy signature detected by the body scanner, identified as the Doctor's Time Ring located below his left elbow, and integral to the functioning of the device.
objects.purpose: Power source for the Time Ring (as detected)
objects.significance: Key to understanding the operation of the Time Ring and its technology

objects.name: Security Scan Cards
objects.description: Coded cards generated by the body scanner after each security scan, containing detailed results of physiological and threat assessments, which are then filed as part of routine protocol.
objects.purpose: Store and record scan data
objects.significance: Serves as a security record and data collection method

objects.name: Inner Door
objects.description: A secondary barrier within the Bunker beyond the initial security checkpoint, opened to allow guards to escort prisoners further inside, representing an additional layer of controlled access.
objects.purpose: Provide a further security barrier
objects.significance: Symbolizes layered security within the facility

objects.name: Readout
objects.description: The output display from the security scan instruments, showing detailed biological data such as physiological compositions and encephalographic patterns. It notably reveals anomalies in the Doctor's biological makeup.
objects.purpose: Display the results of a security scan
objects.significance: Confirms the Doctor's alien physiology, challenging Kaled scientific assumptions

objects.name: Dalek
objects.description: A concept representing the 'travel machine' envisioned by Davros—a bio-mechanical entity designed for racial survival and domination, embodying a ruthless vision of power.
objects.purpose: Facilitate racial survival and domination
objects.significance: Central point of debate and symbol of Davros's vision of a new Kaled future

objects.name: Daleks
objects.description: Monstrous creatures in the incubation room that the Doctor intends to destroy, representing the existential threat they pose with their capacity for mass destruction.
objects.purpose: Target for destruction
objects.significance: Embodies the central threat that motivates the Doctor's actions

objects.name: Sink Plunger Attachment
objects.description: A primitive, sucker-like appendage found on the early Dalek prototype, indicating its rudimentary state without a functional weapon system.
objects.purpose: Serves as a tactile organ in the early design
objects.significance: Highlights the early, incomplete development of the Dalek

objects.name: Voice Control
objects.description: A feature of the Mark Three travel machine allowing verbal command over the Dalek, representing a significant technological achievement in remote control.
objects.purpose: Enable remote verbal control of the Dalek
objects.significance: Symbolizes the technological advancement and control over creation

objects.name: Gun Unit
objects.description: A weapon component for the Dalek, added to transform it from a travel machine into a war machine. Fitted by Nyder's aide under Davros's direction, it marks an upgrade in lethality.
objects.purpose: Provide a powerful energy weapon for self-defense
objects.significance: Represents the weaponization and increased threat level of the Dalek

objects.name: Weapon
objects.description: Gharman's weapon, handed to a colleague in a symbolic gesture, representing the potential for violence while also reflecting a conscious choice to favor debate over force.
objects.purpose: Self-defense and as a symbol of potential violence
objects.significance: Embodies the conflict between the use of violence and the pursuit of a bloodless resolution

objects.name: Weapons
objects.description: A collection of various firearms and explosives stored in the armory for use by the Kaled Elite's security forces, signifying the means of armed conflict and control within the Bunker.
objects.purpose: Armament for security forces and rebels
objects.significance: Symbolizes power, control, and the shift towards violent confrontation

objects.name: Switch
objects.description: A control mechanism on Davros's console used to activate different functions of the Dalek. It enables the initiation of total self-control and can interrupt the Dalek's extermination sequence.
objects.purpose: Control Dalek functions
objects.significance: Represents the interplay between creator and creation, and the point of technological intervention

objects.name: Distronic Explosives
objects.description: Highly unstable and dangerous materials used by the Thals as the payload for their rocket, characterized by immense destructive power and hazardous radiation.
objects.purpose: To be loaded into the Thal rocket for mass destruction
objects.significance: Represents the Thals' desperation and reliance on powerful, destructive weapons

objects.name: Monitor
objects.description: The monitor displays visual information showing the aftermath of the Thal rocket attack on the Kaled Dome. It acts as a stark confirmation of destruction and functions as a catalyst for further dramatic action.
objects.purpose: Display visual information.
objects.significance: Provides visual confirmation of destruction and triggers subsequent actions, such as Davros's vengeful declaration and the unleashing of the Daleks.

objects.name: Monitor
objects.description: This monitor, located in Davros' office, is a large screen that provides a live surveillance feed of the laboratory below, allowing remote observation of ongoing events. It helps frame the scene with dramatic irony as characters witness events unfolding from afar.
objects.purpose: To display surveillance footage of the laboratory.
objects.significance: Provides visual information and dramatic irony, framing the scene by showing events from a detached perspective.

objects.name: Cylinders
objects.description: The cylinders are metal containers designed to hold and transport distronic explosives. Their robust design allows them to be easily loaded and safely handle the volatile materials, despite the inherent danger.
objects.purpose: To carry and store the distronic explosives that are to be loaded into the rocket.
objects.significance: Essential for the Thals' plan to launch their rocket, indicating the urgency and risk of their operation.

objects.name: Notes (Doctor's gobbledygook)
objects.description: These 'reams of notes' contain the scientific gobbledygook and technical jargon invented by the Doctor during his interrogation of the Kaled scientists. They serve as a clever deception, confounding his captors with seemingly complex but ultimately meaningless language.
objects.purpose: Deception and misinformation.
objects.significance: Acts as a tool in the Doctor's escape strategy by delaying Kaled research through intellectual trickery.

objects.name: Mark Three Travel Machine
objects.description: Originally designated as the 'Mark Three travel machine', this apparatus was intended as a travel machine with initial life support functions but also carried implications of weaponization. Its evolution into the Dalek marks a pivotal shift from benign transportation to a menacing weapon.
objects.purpose: Travel machine and, implied, a weapon.
objects.significance: Represents scientific ambition and the potential for misuse, acting as a precursor to the Dalek.

objects.name: Chemical Weapons
objects.description: Chemical weapons used in the early stages of the Kaled-Thal war, responsible for initiating genetic mutations among the Kaled population. Their usage underscores the destructive lengths taken during conflict.
objects.purpose: Warfare and destruction.
objects.significance: Serves as the initial cause of genetic mutations and symbolizes the destructive nature of the war.

objects.name: Genetic Mutations
objects.description: Genetic mutations emerged as a consequence of chemical and radiation weapons used in warfare. These mutations, viewed as undesirable by the Kaled Elite, led to severe social divisions and the marginalization of the 'mutos'.
objects.purpose: A consequence of warfare that prompts evolutionary change.
objects.significance: Acts as a motivating factor for Davros’s experiments, highlighting the costs of war and the resultant societal rifts.

objects.name: Living Cells
objects.description: Living cells constitute the fundamental biological material manipulated by Davros in his experiments. Treated with chemicals to induce accelerated mutations, these cells form the basis for creating his 'ultimate creature'.
objects.purpose: Serve as biological material for experimentation.
objects.significance: Represent the foundation of Davros’s genetic engineering endeavors and his willingness to cross ethical boundaries in pursuit of scientific hubris.

objects.name: Ultimate Creature
objects.description: The ultimate creature is the monstrous end product of Davros's genetic experiments, derived from living cells that have been chemically manipulated to accelerate mutation. It embodies Davros's vision of an evolved, final form of the Kaled race.
objects.purpose: To realize Davros’s vision of Kaled evolution into an ultimate life form.
objects.significance: Represents an ethical and moral dilemma, foreshadowing the emergence of the Daleks and symbolizing uncontrolled scientific ambition.

objects.name: Viewing Panel
objects.description: Set into the door of the incubation room, the viewing panel is a control mechanism activated to reveal the grotesque life forms being developed by Davros. It offers a glimpse into the dark results of unethical scientific experimentation.
objects.purpose: To observe the creatures being developed in the incubation room.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the moral and ethical dilemmas surrounding experimental scientific practices.

objects.name: Scaffolding
objects.description: A towering metal framework constructed of interconnected rungs and horizontal platforms. It surrounds the Thal rocket from the silo floor to the dome's ceiling, serving both construction and escape purposes. The descriptions from two sources are merged to emphasize its dual role in maintenance and as a precarious pathway to freedom.
objects.purpose: Used for rocket construction and maintenance, as well as serving as an escape route.
objects.significance: Represents a dangerous, physical obstacle and the only means of escape from the rocket silo.

objects.name: Nose Cone
objects.description: The nose cone is the smoothly curved, metallic tip of the Thal rocket. Small and exposed, it is positioned at the top of the scaffolding adjacent to a section of the dome roof that can slide open.
objects.purpose: Serves as an aerodynamic component of the rocket and a potential exit point to the dome surface.
objects.significance: Represents the final, precarious stage of the escape, acting as a gateway to potential freedom.

objects.name: Distronic Toxaemia
objects.description: Distronic toxaemia is the condition resulting from prolonged exposure to distronic explosives. It is a lethal state caused by dangerous radiation, leading to a slow deterioration of the body.
objects.purpose: Represents the toxic effect and cause of death from exposure to distronic explosives.
objects.significance: Highlights the immediate danger and lethal conditions faced by those forced to handle these explosives, motivating desperate escape attempts.

objects.name: Chemical Formula
objects.description: A seemingly simple piece of paper that contains a chemical formula designed to weaken the Kaled dome's molecular structure. Handed over by Nyder, this document holds potentially war-altering information.
objects.purpose: To provide a means to weaken the Kaled defenses.
objects.significance: Represents the manipulative strategies used in warfare and the drastic measures taken by Davros in pursuit of his goals.

objects.name: Rocket
objects.description: A massive projectile serving as the Thals' ultimate weapon, the rocket is designed to destroy the Kaled dome. It combines advanced technology with raw destructive potential and is central to the Thals' military gamble.
objects.purpose: To serve as a superweapon against the Kaled forces.
objects.significance: Embodies the Thals' desperate reliance on technology for victory, symbolizing both their hope and the immense risks they take.

objects.name: Gap
objects.description: The gap is a roughly meter-wide void between the rocket scaffolding and the nose cone platform, marked by a dizzying drop to the silo floor. It is a clear representation of a dangerous physical obstacle.
objects.purpose: Acts as a physical obstacle that creates tension and danger during the escape attempt.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the immense risk and the 'leap of faith' required for escape.

objects.name: Giant Clam
objects.description: A grotesque mollusk with a rapidly snapping shell, the giant clam lurks in the cave as a dangerous predator. Its sudden and aggressive reactions to movement pose a lethal threat to unwary travelers.
objects.purpose: Acts as a predatory hazard for characters navigating the caves.
objects.significance: Symbolizes hidden dangers in seemingly innocuous environments and adds to the tension of the scene.

objects.name: Stalactite
objects.description: A mineral formation that hangs from the ceiling of the cave, formed by the slow accumulation of minerals from dripping water over thousands of years. It embodies both natural beauty and danger.
objects.purpose: Can be used as a tool or weapon when broken off.
objects.significance: Represents the natural hazards of the cave environment as well as a potential resource during escape.

objects.name: Optical Systems
objects.description: Components of the Daleks responsible for visual perception, these systems are identified by Davros as needing refinement to meet his exacting standards. They underline both functionality and the ambition for perfection in Dalek design.
objects.purpose: Provide visual perception capabilities.
objects.significance: Highlights Davros's attention to detail and pursuit of perfection in the Dalek prototypes.

objects.name: Sensory Circuits
objects.description: Integral components that enable the Daleks to perceive environmental stimuli beyond just visual input. These circuits are subject to improvements aimed at achieving heightened accuracy and sensitivity.
objects.purpose: Enable advanced environmental perception.
objects.significance: Emphasizes Davros's drive to equip the Daleks with reliable and superior sensory capabilities.

objects.name: Viewer Circuit
objects.description: A component within the Dalek prototypes that is ordered to be dismantled by Davros. Its removal suggests it is outdated or redundant as part of his ongoing refinements in Dalek design.
objects.purpose: Serves as an internal component of Dalek sensory input, now targeted for removal.
objects.significance: Illustrates the continuous refinement and modification of Dalek design by Davros.

objects.name: Communication System
objects.description: The communication system of the Bunker, controlled by Kavell, facilitates both internal and external communications. It is instrumental for monitoring and intercepting sensitive information, including updates about escape attempts and interactions with Kaled leaders.
objects.purpose: Information dissemination and surveillance.
objects.significance: Highlights Kavell's access to sensitive information and his influential role in the unfolding events.

objects.name: Loads
objects.description: Heavily radiating ingots of distronic explosive material, these loads are physically cumbersome and dangerous. They are emblematic of the forced labor and the mortal peril encountered by the slaves tasked with transporting them.
objects.purpose: Transport distronic explosives into the rocket.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the harsh conditions of forced labor and the omnipresent danger of radiation.

objects.name: Map of Rocket Silo Area
objects.description: The map of the Rocket Silo Area is a guide promised by Ravon to help the Doctor and Harry navigate the service shafts beneath the Thal City. It provides a layout of the dangerous tunnels leading to the rocket silo and is essential for their mission to locate and rescue Sarah.
objects.purpose: Navigation, Guidance
objects.significance: Essential for infiltration and rescue mission

objects.name: Protective Dome
objects.description: The Protective Dome is a reinforced structure covering Kaled City. Designed to shield it from Thal attacks – including their 'great rocket' – it features a new substance that reinforces its structure to the strength of thirty-foot thick reinforced concrete. It symbolizes Kaled resilience and technological superiority.
objects.purpose: Defense, Protection
objects.significance: Key to Kaled defense strategy, source of Kaled confidence

objects.name: Service Shafts
objects.description: The Service Shafts are a network of tunnels located beneath Thal City, providing access to the Rocket Silo Area. These secret passageways are presented as dangerous and crucial for infiltrating the Thal Dome in order to find Sarah.
objects.purpose: Secret Passage, Infiltration Route
objects.significance: Escape route, point of entry into Thal city

objects.name: Hatch in the floor
objects.description: A concealed opening in the floor that provides hidden access into the Thal corridor from levels below. It enables the Doctor and Harry to emerge discreetly into enemy territory, facilitating covert infiltration.
objects.purpose: Hidden access
objects.significance: Secret infiltration point

objects.name: Ventilation grill
objects.description: Integrated into the base of the meeting room door, this ventilation grill not only facilitates air circulation but also serves as an acoustic conduit to eavesdrop on conversations occurring within the room.
objects.purpose: Ventilation and eavesdropping
objects.significance: Opportunity for intelligence gathering

objects.name: Round porthole
objects.description: A small, circular glass window set into the meeting room door that provides limited visual access into the room. It allows for discreet surveillance to observe occupants and verify the presence of Davros.
objects.purpose: Visual observation
objects.significance: Discreet surveillance point

objects.name: Formula
objects.description: Although not a tangible object, the Formula is the secret knowledge detailing how the Thals were enabled to destroy the Kaled protective dome. It represents catastrophic information that can lead to the 'total extermination of our people'.
objects.purpose: To weaken the Kaled protective dome
objects.significance: Represents betrayal and the destruction of the Kaled dome

objects.name: Shells
objects.description: Artillery projectiles designed to be filled with the chemical formula provided by Davros. Ordered by the Thal Councillor, these shells are deployed as a barrage against the Kaled protective dome, acting as the delivery system for Davros's treacherous plan.
objects.purpose: To deliver the chemical formula to the Kaled dome
objects.significance: Delivery system for Davros's destructive formula

objects.name: Protective Gear
objects.description: Radiation suits worn by the Thal guards encountered by the Doctor and Harry. These suits protect against hazardous environments, likely involving radiation or chemical agents, emphasizing the dangers within Thal facilities.
objects.purpose: To protect against hazardous environments
objects.significance: Indicates hazardous environment and Thal preparedness

objects.name: Spy Disguise
objects.description: A persona adopted by the Doctor as a clever ruse to approach the Thal guards. Rather than a physical costume, it is a performance relying on wit and feigned cooperation to distract the guards and allow Harry to subdue them.
objects.purpose: To deceive and distract Thal guards
objects.significance: Doctor's deceptive tactic

objects.name: Tape Recording
objects.description: Holding vital information about the Daleks' weaknesses—captured during the Doctor's earlier interrogation—this recording could potentially alter the future of the Daleks and the universe. It serves as a crucial piece of evidence.
objects.purpose: To document the Doctor's forced confession detailing Dalek weaknesses.
objects.significance: It could alter the future of the Daleks and the universe.

objects.name: Countdown Timer
objects.description: A digital clock used to track the launch sequence of the rocket. By counting down from a specified time, it creates urgency and tension as the Thals prepare to launch their assault on the Kaled dome.
objects.purpose: To track the countdown to rocket launch.
objects.significance: Heightens tension by serving as a reminder of imminent destruction.

objects.name: Dalek gun
objects.description: A weapon discovered by Sarah on a sideboard in Davros' office, notable for its ironic use in destroying sensitive information rather than causing conventional harm. Its presence underscores the pervasive influence of Dalek technology.
objects.purpose: Weapon, repurposed to destroy the tape recording.
objects.significance: Ironic choice of weapon to destroy information about Daleks; represents Dalek technology.

objects.name: Chromosomal Variations Outline
objects.description: A piece of paper or datapad containing Davros's written orders detailing the chromosomal variations to be introduced into the embryo Daleks. It documents the specific genetic modifications aimed at creating a ruthless race devoid of conscience.
objects.purpose: To document and communicate Davros's genetic modification orders.
objects.significance: Represents Davros's direct control over Dalek evolution and his intention to create ruthless creatures.

objects.name: Orders
objects.description: Davros's commands to Gharman and Nyder regarding the genetic modifications and deployment of the Daleks. The orders demand immediate compliance and confirm the Daleks' readiness, setting the final steps in motion for their creation and use as weapons of war.
objects.purpose: To direct the actions of his team and ensure the continued development of the Daleks.
objects.significance: Pivotal in driving the plot forward towards the Daleks' creation and deployment.

objects.name: Dalek Prototype
objects.description: An early version of the Dalek representing the culmination of Davros's scientific ambitions. Though still incomplete, its mechanical design and intended function as a weapon of war underscore the terrifying potential of Davros's vision.
objects.purpose: To serve as a bio-mechanical entity for war and extermination.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the terrifying potential of Davros's ambition and the threat posed to the universe.

objects.name: Dalek force
objects.description: The collective army of Dalek machines that Davros is determined to build. More than individual units, it is envisioned as an unstoppable military entity intended to secure Kaled survival and dominate the universe.
objects.purpose: To become the dominant military power in the universe
objects.significance: Represents Davros's ambition and the imminent threat of the Daleks

objects.name: Glorious project
objects.description: Davros's term for building his Dalek force. This concept reflects his megalomaniacal obsession and frames the creation of a destructive army as a celebrated achievement of Kaled science and evolution, despite its terrifying moral implications.
objects.purpose: To build the Dalek force
objects.significance: Represents Davros's distorted view of the Dalek project as a positive endeavor

objects.name: Rock
objects.description: A large, jagged stone picked up by a Muto to use as an improvised weapon during an attack on the Doctor. It underscores the brutal, resourceful nature of combat in the wastelands, where even a simple rock can become lethal.
objects.purpose: Weapon
objects.significance: Improvised Weapon, Symbol of Wasteland Brutality

objects.name: Dimensional Thought Circuit
objects.description: An electronic component crucial for operating advanced robotic systems, likely used in the development of Daleks. It embodies the complex technological framework behind Davros's designs.
objects.purpose: To manage dimensional processing in advanced robotic systems.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the advanced technological framework of Davros's research.

objects.name: Dalek Weakness
objects.description: An abstract objective referring to any vulnerability or flaw in the Daleks' design or programming that the Doctor seeks to exploit. It represents the strategic hope to defeat a seemingly invincible enemy.
objects.purpose: Strategic Objective: To exploit vulnerabilities in the Daleks.
objects.significance: Represents hope and a potential vulnerability in the Dalek threat.

objects.name: Elite's troops
objects.description: The security forces of Davros's Elite Scientific Corps, these well-trained and loyal soldiers act as his personal guard within the Bunker. They are key to maintaining his control over the research operations.
objects.purpose: Enforcement & Security
objects.significance: Davros's Power Base

objects.name: Ultimatum
objects.description: A proposed demand by Gharman aimed at ethically reining in the Dalek project. It consists of conditions to restore conscience to the Daleks or halt their development entirely, symbolizing a critical ethical stand against Davros's methods.
objects.purpose: To ethically control the Dalek project or destroy it.
objects.significance: Represents the ethical conflict within Davros's Research Group and challenges his authority.

objects.name: Brain Surgery
objects.description: A chilling proposal by Davros involving a literal 'surgery on the brain' to remove dissent—effectively lobotomizing opponents while retaining their scientific skills. This act underscores his ruthlessness and dehumanizing control.
objects.purpose: To eliminate dissent and retain useful skills.
objects.significance: Illustrates Davros's ruthlessness and disregard for human dignity.

objects.name: Ventilator Shaft
objects.description: Part of the Bunker's ventilation system noted for producing a mysterious distant banging noise. It hints at the presence of unseen characters, adding an element of suspense and foreshadowing within the narrative.
objects.purpose: Ventilation, source of a mysterious noise.
objects.significance: Foreshadows the presence of unseen characters (Doctor and companions).

objects.name: Torture Chair
objects.description: The torture chair is a menacing device central to the interrogation room, featuring integrated straps and wires. It is designed to physically restrain and psychologically intimidate prisoners, inflicting pain through technological means. Its presence is a potent symbol of Davros's ruthless methods and the Doctor's vulnerability.
objects.purpose: To physically restrain and psychologically intimidate prisoners during interrogation.
objects.significance: Symbolizes Davros's ruthlessness and the Doctor's vulnerability.

objects.name: Wires
objects.description: The wires are bare electrical conductors that the Doctor reaches for in the corridor. They are essential for completing the electrical circuit necessary to detonate explosives, marking a moment of high immediate tension.
objects.purpose: To complete electrical circuit, trigger explosives.
objects.significance: Doctor's plan, imminent detonation.

objects.name: Computer Analysis
objects.description: This analysis, mentioned by Davros, dismisses the suggestion that the Doctor has time-traveled. It reflects the limitations of Kaled technology and serves as evidence of Davros's initial skepticism, relying on empirical data despite the extraordinary nature of the claims.
objects.purpose: To analyze interrogation reports and dismiss claims of time travel.
objects.significance: Represents Kaled technological limitations and Davros's initial skepticism.

objects.name: Initial Reports of Interrogation
objects.description: Documents containing early interrogation reports that mention the Doctor's potential time travel. They provide background context and establish Davros's prior engagement with the Doctor's story, setting the stage for the evolving interrogation strategy.
objects.purpose: To provide background information and context for Davros's interrogation.
objects.significance: Establishes Davros's initial skepticism and the context of the scene.

objects.name: Explosives
objects.description: Explosives implied as the decisive means by which the Doctor intends to destroy the incubator room. They symbolize the Doctor's readiness to commit to drastic measures with irreversible consequences, marking a point of no return.
objects.purpose: To destroy the incubator room.
objects.significance: Means of destruction, drastic action.

objects.name: Pain Giver
objects.description: An implied device in the interrogation room used to enact torture. Though not physically described in detail, it is known for its adjustable intensity and is employed to coerce prisoners for information, emphasizing the brutal methods in use.
objects.purpose: Torture, coercion, and interrogation.
objects.significance: Symbol of Davros's ruthlessness and interrogation methods.

objects.name: Tape Recorder
objects.description: A functional recording device used in the interrogation room to capture the Doctor's forced confession. Its operation—and eventual stoppage—underscores its vital role in documenting invaluable information on Dalek weaknesses.
objects.purpose: Recording interrogation, data capture.
objects.significance: Captures invaluable Dalek weakness information.

objects.name: Magnetic Tape
objects.description: The physical medium housed within the tape recorder used to store the Doctor's recorded interrogation. Described as a reel of magnetic tape, it is of paramount importance as it holds potentially universe-altering information regarding Dalek weaknesses.
objects.purpose: Data storage, information repository.
objects.significance: Contains priceless Dalek weakness information.

objects.name: Dalek Invasion of the Earth in the Year 2000
objects.description: A historical event recounted by the Doctor, detailing a past Dalek attempt to invade Earth that was thwarted by the planet's magnetic properties and human resistance. It serves as a critical example of Dalek failure through environmental factors.
objects.purpose: Historical example of Dalek failure, interrogation information.
objects.significance: Reveals Dalek vulnerability to planetary magnetic fields and human resistance.

objects.name: Dalek Defeat on Mars
objects.description: A historical event where the Daleks were defeated on Mars due to a virus that attacked the insulation of their electrical systems. This failure highlights a technological weakness exploitable by their enemies.
objects.purpose: Historical example of Dalek failure, interrogation information.
objects.significance: Reveals Dalek vulnerability to viruses affecting electrical insulation.

objects.name: Dalek War Against Venusian Colonies in Space Year Seventeen Thousand
objects.description: A historical conflict in which a war between the Daleks and Venusian colonies was halted by a war rocket fleet from Hyperon, using metals resistant to Dalek firepower. This event reveals a material vulnerability in Dalek armor.
objects.purpose: Historical example of Dalek failure, interrogation information.
objects.significance: Reveals Dalek vulnerability to specific resistant metals.

objects.name: Cosh
objects.description: A blunt, hand-held weapon, concealed by Kavell and used as an improvised means to incapacitate guards. It contrasts with advanced technological weaponry and symbolizes the breakdown of order as direct violence replaces conventional control.
objects.purpose: To incapacitate guards and assert control during the rebellion.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the breakdown of order and violent resistance against Davros.

objects.name: Pass
objects.description: A hypothetical authorization document, implied to be signed by Davros, that regulates prisoner access. Its mention underscores the pervasive bureaucratic control within the Bunker and is used by Kavell as part of a deceptive tactic.
objects.purpose: Authorization for prisoner access.
objects.significance: Symbolizes bureaucratic control and Kavell's deception.

objects.name: Recall Command
objects.description: Davros's cold, mechanical order commanding all Dalek units to withdraw from the Thal dome and return to the bunker. This strategic redeployment indicates a calculated shift in Davros's overall plan.
objects.purpose: Strategic redeployment.
objects.significance: Signals a change in Dalek tactics and raises questions about Davros's ultimate plan.

objects.name: Detention Room Door
objects.description: A solid, metal door designed to secure the detention room. Operated manually, it serves as a physical barrier between freedom and captivity, playing a pivotal role as characters manipulate its access for control.
objects.purpose: Security.
objects.significance: Acts as a barrier symbolizing confinement and control.

objects.name: Guards' Weapons
objects.description: Standard issue rifles or blasters carried by Kaled security guards in the armory. After the guards are overpowered, these weapons become emblems of the shifting power dynamics during the rebellion.
objects.purpose: Standard issue security weaponry.
objects.significance: Symbolizes the fall of Davros's authority as they are used by the rebels.

objects.name: Keys
objects.description: The keys used by Gharman to unlock the cupboard or armory door, representing both literal and figurative access to the weapons stored inside. Their retrieval is crucial to arming the rebellion.
objects.purpose: To unlock the armory and access weapons.
objects.significance: Symbol of access to resources, enabling the rebellion.

objects.name: Cupboard
objects.description: A large, locked storage unit located in the corridor, used to store military supplies such as camouflage clothing and explosives. Its locked state adds to its narrative as a secure repository of critical resources.
objects.purpose: Storage of military supplies.
objects.significance: Represents a source of valuable resources crucial for the rebellion.

objects.name: Camouflage Clothing
objects.description: Disguise clothing found within the locked cupboard. Although considered useful for concealment within a war-torn environment, its narrative role is secondary to more critical resources like explosives.
objects.purpose: Disguise and concealment.
objects.significance: A minor find compared to the importance of explosives.

objects.name: Detonators
objects.description: Components found alongside the explosives in the cupboard that are essential for triggering the detonation. Their presence confirms access to a complete set of tools necessary for large-scale destruction.
objects.purpose: Triggering explosives.
objects.significance: Essential component for the Doctor's plan.

objects.name: Detonator
objects.description: A detonator prepared by Bettan to trigger explosives at the bunker entrance. It symbolizes finality and irreversible destruction, embodying the desperate measures of the Thal resistance against the Dalek threat.
objects.purpose: To trigger explosives and seal the bunker entrance.
objects.significance: Represents the means to execute the final, desperate act of the Thal resistance.

objects.name: Time Lord's Options
objects.description: The three choices presented to the Doctor by the Time Lords regarding the Daleks' genesis: to discover a weakness, alter their genetic development, or prevent their creation via genocide. These options frame the Doctor's constrained mission and highlight his moral dilemma.
objects.purpose: Defining the Doctor's mission.
objects.significance: Establishes the context for the Doctor's plan.

objects.name: Genocide
objects.description: In this context, genocide refers to the Doctor's extreme intention to destroy the Daleks by killing everything in the incubation room. It encapsulates a morally fraught plan, representing the most drastic option presented by the Time Lords.
objects.purpose: Preventing the Daleks' creation.
objects.significance: Represents the Doctor's extreme and ethically fraught plan.

objects.name: Viewing Portal
objects.description: A small, button-operated opening in the door of the incubation room that provides a view into its green-lit interior. This controlled access point heightens the sense of dread and anticipation by revealing the horrors within.
objects.purpose: To observe the interior of the incubation room.
objects.significance: Provides a visual gateway to the horrors within by controlling the reveal of the Dalek embryos.

objects.name: Detonator Wires
objects.description: The detonator wires are lengths of wire connected to explosive charges, given to Harry by the Doctor. They are part of his improvised bomb intended to remotely detonate explosives planted in the incubation room. They symbolize the Doctor's hazardous plan and the burden of responsibility placed on Harry.
objects.purpose: To detonate explosives remotely.
objects.significance: Enables the Doctor's strategy to destroy the Daleks at their genesis.

objects.name: Charges
objects.description: The charges are explosive devices that the Doctor intends to plant within the incubation room. Their precise specifications are not detailed, though they are implied to bear enough power to cause significant damage.
objects.purpose: To destroy the contents of the Incubation Room.
objects.significance: Central to the Doctor's plan of genocide, embodying the destructive potential of his mission.

objects.name: Destruct Button
objects.description: The Destruct Button is a large, red control mounted on a console in the laboratory. Its prominent placement and design indicate its role as the ultimate decision point for triggering destruction.
objects.purpose: To initiate the destruction of the bunker and its inhabitants.
objects.significance: It embodies the power of annihilation and the stark, irreversible decision facing the Kaled Elite.

objects.name: Heart Instrument
objects.description: The Heart Instrument is a tiny, life-sustaining device designed by Davros and implanted in Kravos's chest. It represents both advanced medical technology and Davros's ability to control life and death.
objects.purpose: Life support, Manipulation
objects.significance: Represents Davros's life-saving capabilities and manipulative tactics using past favors.

objects.name: Wall Safe
objects.description: The wall safe is a secure, built-in storage unit in Davros' office, marked by a prominent Elite corps symbol. It is designed to protect valuable items, in this case, the tape recording.
objects.purpose: To securely store valuable items, specifically the tape recording.
objects.significance: Contains the tape recording of Dalek weaknesses; represents Davros's secrets and control.

objects.name: Tape
objects.description: The tape is a small magnetic recording device stored within Davros' safe, containing the Doctor's forced confession detailing Dalek weaknesses. Its compact nature belies its high informational impact.
objects.purpose: To record and store information, specifically the Doctor's confession about Dalek weaknesses.
objects.significance: Contains crucial information about Dalek weaknesses; its destruction is vital to the Doctor's mission.

objects.name: Office Door
objects.description: The office door secures Davros' office. Described once as a sturdy barrier that traps the Doctor, Sarah, and Harry inside the office when it is locked, it is noted for its robustness and resistance (even defying the Doctor's sonic screwdriver).
objects.purpose: To secure Davros' office.
objects.significance: Traps the Doctor and companions temporarily; symbolizes confinement and high security.

objects.name: Last Explosive Charge
objects.description: This explosive charge is the final component positioned by a Thal soldier at the bunker entrance. Its placement completes the setup required for the eventual detonation.
objects.purpose: To complete the explosives setup for detonation.
objects.significance: Represents the final step in the Thal's desperate plan to seal off the bunker.

objects.name: Scanners
objects.description: The scanners are pieces of electronic equipment at the blockhouse checkpoint that receive and display images from within the bunker. They serve as a visual and auditory link to the unfolding events.
objects.purpose: Surveillance, Communication
objects.significance: Serve as the audience's viewpoint into the bunker and provide crucial information on the events inside.

objects.name: Tunnel Doors
objects.description: The Tunnel Doors are heavy, metal sliding barriers at the bunker entrance. Their construction is meant to securely seal off the tunnel and restrict access.
objects.purpose: Seal bunker entrance.
objects.significance: Act as a barrier to escape and mark the point of no return as the bunker is sealed.

objects.name: Davros [on screen]
objects.description: Davros's image projected on a scanner screen, commanding authority and issuing orders. His on-screen presence reiterates his control over the Daleks and the bunker’s security.
objects.purpose: Issuing commands, Projecting authority.
objects.significance: Represents Davros's continued control and serves as an antagonist presence.

objects.name: Dalek [on screen]
objects.description: The Dalek’s projected image on the scanner screen, accompanied by its mechanical voice delivering the phrase 'I obey'. It reinforces the Dalek’s nature as a ruthless enforcer.
objects.purpose: Relaying orders, Demonstrating obedience.
objects.significance: Symbolizes Dalek obedience and the ever-present threat they pose.

objects.name: Circuit
objects.description: The circuit is the electrical path that the Doctor must complete by connecting bare wires. It represents the mechanism through which the explosives are triggered.
objects.purpose: To trigger explosives.
objects.significance: Acts as the final mechanism of detonation, marking the culmination of the Doctor's plan.

objects.name: Plunger Handle
objects.description: The Plunger Handle is a part of the detonator device, designed to be lifted by a Thal soldier as the trigger for the explosives. Its physical activation builds suspense towards detonation.
objects.purpose: Initiate detonation.
objects.significance: Embodies the physical action required to start the destructive sequence.

objects.name: Incubator Room
objects.description: The incubator room, though not physically present in the scene, is the focal point of conversation regarding the site of Dalek genesis. It carries the weight of moral dilemma and impending threat.
objects.purpose: To house and cultivate developing Dalek organisms.
objects.significance: Represents the heart of the Dalek genesis and the Doctor's moral dilemma.

objects.name: Look
objects.description: A stage direction that cues a shift in focus, drawing attention to an unspecified external element. Its underspecified nature builds suspense, foreshadowing an upcoming event.
objects.purpose: To direct attention and create suspense.
objects.significance: Signals a shift in focus and foreshadows an imminent event.
